Re-: A prefix signifying back, against, again, anew; as, recline, to lean back; recall, to call back; recede; remove; reclaim, to call out against; repugn, to fight against; recognition, a knowing again; rejoin, to join again; reiterate; reassure. Combinations containing the prefix re- are readily formed, and are for the most part of obvious signification.
Respirability: The quality or state of being respirable; respirableness.
Regally: In a regal or royal manner.
Rumkin: A popular or jocular name for a drinking vessel.
Rivery: Having rivers; as, a rivery country.
Reservoir: A place where anything is kept in store; especially, a place where water is collected and kept for use when wanted, as to supply a fountain, a canal, or a city by means of aqueducts, or to drive a mill wheel, or the like.
Risk: To expose to risk, hazard, or peril; to venture; as, to risk goods on board of a ship; to risk one's person in battle; to risk one's fame by a publication.
ratable: a structure which may be rated, or set at a certain value, for the purpose of taxation, usually based on the value; as, with the deterioration of the center cities, the loss of ratables worsened the situation by removing valuable sources of tax revenue.
Repristination: Restoration to an original state; renewal of purity.
Rhodanic: Pertaining to, or designating, an acid (commonly called sulphocyanic acid) which frms a red color with ferric salts.
Rudderpost: The shank of a rudder, having the blade at one end and the attachments for operating it at the other.
Rigidity: The quality or state of being rigid; want of pliability; the quality of resisting change of form; the amount of resistance with which a body opposes change of form; -- opposed to flexibility, ductility, malleability, and softness.
Reprieve: A temporary suspension of the execution of a sentence, especially of a sentence of death.
Ratitate: Of or pertaining to the Ratitæ.
Readmission: The act of admitting again, or the state of being readmitted; as, the readmission of fresh air into an exhausted receiver; the readmission of a student into a seminary.
Refreshment: The act of refreshing, or the state of being refreshed; restoration of strength, spirit, vigor, or liveliness; relief after suffering; new life or animation after depression.
Rumbler: One who, or that which, rumbles.
Requite: To repay; in a good sense, to recompense; to return (an equivalent) in good; to reward; in a bad sense, to retaliate; to return (evil) for evil; to punish.
Ritornelle: A short return or repetition; a concluding symphony to an air, often consisting of the burden of the song.
Roughshod: Shod with shoes armed with points or calks; as, a roughshod horse.
Rusma: A depilatory made of orpiment and quicklime, and used by the Turks. See Rhusma.
Refitment: The act of refitting, or the state of being refitted.
Renidification: The act of rebuilding a nest.
Round up: to collect or gather together scattered animals, persons, or things.
Radiant: The luminous point or object from which light emanates; also, a body radiating light brightly.
Rabato: A kind of ruff for the neck; a turned-down collar; a rebato.
Renaissant: Of or pertaining to the Renaissance.
Re\u00ebcho: The echo of an echo; a repeated or second echo.
Rubellite: A variety of tourmaline varying in color from a pale rose to a deep ruby, and containing lithium.
&Verbar;Rostellum: A small beaklike process or extension of some part; a small rostrum; as, the rostellum of the stigma of violets, or of the operculum of many mosses; the rostellum on the head of a tapeworm.
&Verbar;Rapprochement: Act or fact of coming or being drawn near or together; establishment or state of cordial relations.
Reassume: To assume again or anew; to resume.
Renitence: The state or quality of being renitent; resistance; reluctance.
Recharter: To charter again or anew; to grant a second or another charter to.
Reinless: Not having, or not governed by, reins; hence, not checked or restrained.
&Verbar;Raisonn\u00e9: Arranged systematically, or according to classes or subjects; as, a catalogue raisonné. See under Catalogue.
Reformly: In the manner of a reform; for the purpose of reform.
Rope-yarn: the yarn or thread of any stuff of which the strands of a rope are made.
Refrigerator: That which refrigerates or makes cold; that which keeps cool.
Religionist: One earnestly devoted or attached to a religion; a religious zealot.
&Verbar;Raptores: An order of birds, same as Accipitres. Called also Raptatores.
Ramble: A going or moving from place to place without any determinate business or object; an excursion or stroll merely for recreation.
Red-light district: A district or neighborhood in which houses of prostitution are located; -- so called in allusion to the red light kept in front of many such resorts at night.
Retroversion: A turning or bending backward; also, the state of being turned or bent backward; displacement backwards; as, retroversion of the uterus.
Revolutionize: To change completely, as by a revolution; as, to revolutionize a government.
Ritual: A prescribed form of performing divine service in a particular church or communion; as, the Jewish ritual.
Raisin: A grape, or a bunch of grapes.
Ratafia: A spirituous liquor flavored with the kernels of cherries, apricots, peaches, or other fruit, spiced, and sweetened with sugar; -- a term applied to the liqueurs called noyau, curaçao, etc.
Redpoll: Any one of several species of small northern finches of the genus Acanthis (formerly Ægiothus), native of Europe and America. The adults have the crown red or rosy. The male of the most common species  (Acanthis linarius) has also the breast and rump rosy. Called also redpoll linnet. See Illust. under Linnet.
Robust: Evincing strength; indicating vigorous health; strong; sinewy; muscular; vigorous; sound; as, a robust body; robust youth; robust health.
Religionism: The practice of, or devotion to, religion.
Rencounter: A meeting of two persons or bodies; a collision; especially, a meeting in opposition or contest; a combat, action, or engagement.
Redoubtable: Formidable; dread; terrible to foes; as, a redoubtable hero; hence, valiant; -- often in contempt or burlesque.
Restive: Unwilling to go on; obstinate in refusing to move forward; stubborn; drawing back.
Rockaway: Formerly, a light, low, four-wheeled carriage, with standing top, open at the sides, but having waterproof curtains which could be let down when occasion required; now, a somewhat similar, but heavier, carriage, inclosed, except in front, and having a door at each side.
Ramulose: Having many small branches, or ramuli.
Reliquary: A depositary, often a small box or casket, in which relics are kept.
Ringtail: A bird having a distinct band of color across the tail, as the hen harrier.
Reclamation: The act or process of reclaiming.
Revamp: To vamp again; hence, to patch up; to reconstruct.
&Verbar;Retinaculum: A connecting band; a frænum; as, the retinacula of the ileocæcal and ileocolic valves.
roadkill: The body of an animal killed by a vehicle on a road; as, it is illegal in most places for a restaurant to serve roadkill as food for people.  Also used metaphorically; as, “roadkill on the information superhighway” (a person or corporation defeated by others more expert at using the internet).
Rocking-chair: A chair mounted on rockers, in which one may rock.
Rutaceous: Of or pertaining to plants of a natural order (Rutaceæ) of which the rue is the type, and which includes also the orange, lemon, dittany, and buchu.
Revisory: Having the power or purpose to revise; revising.
Resorcin: A colorless crystalline substance of the phenol series, obtained by melting certain resins, as galbanum, asafetida, etc., with caustic potash. It is also produced artificially and used in making certain dyestuffs, as phthaleïn, fluoresceïn, and eosin.
&Verbar;Rissole: A small ball of rich minced meat or fish, covered with pastry and fried.
Rinker: One who skates at a rink.
Rugging: A coarse kind of woolen cloth, used for wrapping, blanketing, etc.
Resuscitable: Capable of resuscitation; as, resuscitable plants.
Resort: The act of going to, or making application; a betaking one's self; the act of visiting or seeking; recourse; as, a place of popular resort; -- often figuratively; as, to have resort to force.
Rhabdosphere: A minute sphere composed of rhabdoliths.
Rectangularity: The quality or condition of being rectangular, or right-angled.
Rashly: In a rash manner; with precipitation.
round robin: Any series or sequence of actions.
&Verbar;Rejectamenta: Things thrown out or away; especially, things excreted by a living organism.
Rebel: To renounce, and resist by force, the authority of the ruler or government to which one owes obedience. See Rebellion.
Retranslate: To translate anew; especially, to translate back into the original language.
Rebec: An instrument formerly used which somewhat resembled the violin, having three strings, and being played with a bow.
&Verbar;Res: A thing; the particular thing; a matter; a point.
&Verbar;Riant: Laughing; laughable; exciting gayety; gay; merry; delightful to the view, as a landscape.
Recomfort: To comfort again; to console anew; to give new strength to.
Rapier: A straight sword, with a narrow and finely pointed blade, used only for thrusting.
Recrementitial: Of the nature of a recrement. See Recrement, 2 (b).
Robustness: The quality or state of being robust.
Rawly: In a raw manner; unskillfully; without experience.
Reabsorb: To absorb again; to draw in, or imbibe, again what has been effused, extravasated, or thrown off; to swallow up again; as, to reabsorb chyle, lymph, etc.; -- used esp. of fluids.
Reaccess: A second access or approach; a return.
Reliquidate: To liquidate anew; to adjust a second time.
Redeliver: To deliver or give back; to return.
Revertent: A remedy which restores the natural order of the inverted irritative motions in the animal system.
Roughwrought: Wrought in a rough, unfinished way; worked over coarsely.
Railer: One who rails; one who scoffs, insults, censures, or reproaches with opprobrious language.
Restless: Never resting; unquiet; uneasy; continually moving; as, a restless child.
Revendicate: To reclaim; to demand the restoration of.
razor-edged: having an edge as sharp as that of a razor; very sharp.
rubber band: A closed loop of rubber usually having a thin rectangular cross-section; also called elastic band; -- it varies in length from the circumference of a finger to several inches, and is usually used to hold several objects together temporarily, by the tension exerted when the band is stretched and fitted around the objects to be held; as, to hold a pack of cards together with a rubber band.
Rose-cut: Cut flat on the reverse, and with a convex face formed of triangular facets in rows; -- said of diamonds and other precious stones. See Rose diamond, under Rose.  Cf. Brilliant, n.
Regulate: To adjust by rule, method, or established mode; to direct by rule or restriction; to subject to governing principles or laws.
Rowboat: A boat designed to be propelled by oars instead of sails.
Right-minded: Having a right or honest mind.
Recovery: The act of recovering, regaining, or retaking possession.
Ridgeband: The part of a harness which passes over the saddle, and supports the shafts of a cart; -- called also ridgerope, and ridger.
Reverently: In a reverent manner; in respectful regard.
Removal: The act of removing, or the state of being removed.
Re: A syllable applied in solmization to the second tone of the diatonic scale of C; in the American system, to the second tone of any diatonic scale.
&Verbar;Rhizophora: A genus of trees including the mangrove. See Mangrove.
Regurgitate: To be thrown or poured back; to rush or surge back.
Rn: the symbol for the chemical element radon.
Regain: To gain anew; to get again; to recover, as what has escaped or been lost; to reach again.
Resting: a. & n. from Rest, v. t. & i.
Referee: One to whom a thing is referred; a person to whom a matter in dispute has been referred, in order that he may settle it.
Raid: To make a raid upon or into; as, two regiments raided the border counties.
Retrospective: Looking backward; contemplating things past; -- opposed to prospective; as, a retrospective view.
Ruler: One who rules; one who exercises sway or authority; a governor.
Restorationist: One who believes in a temporary future punishment and a final restoration of all to the favor and presence of God; a Universalist.
Rain: To pour or shower down from above, like rain from the clouds.
Rivet: To fasten with a rivet, or with rivets; as, to rivet two pieces of iron.
Raip: A rope; also, a measure equal to a rod.
Receiptor: One who receipts; specifically (Law), one who receipts for property which has been taken by the sheriff.
Refraction: The act of refracting, or the state of being refracted.
Respectant: Placed so as to face one another; -- said of animals.
Romp: A girl who indulges in boisterous play.
Raspy: Like a rasp, or the sound made by a rasp; grating.
Reprover: One who, or that which, reproves.
Recenter: To center again; to restore to the center.
Rickets: A disease which affects children, and which is characterized by a bulky head, crooked spine and limbs, depressed ribs, enlarged and spongy articular epiphyses, tumid abdomen, and short stature, together with clear and often premature mental faculties. The essential cause of the disease appears to be the nondeposition of earthy salts in the osteoid tissues. Children afflicted with this malady stand and walk unsteadily. Called also rachitis.
Receiver: One who takes or receives in any manner.
Rearrangement: The act of rearranging, or the state of being rearranged.
Roundhead: A nickname for a Puritan. See Roundheads, the, in the Dictionary of Noted Names in Fiction.
Reside: To dwell permanently or for a considerable time; to have a settled abode for a time; to abide continuosly; to have one's domicile of home; to remain for a long time.
&Verbar;Rosella: A beautiful Australian parrakeet (Platycercus eximius) often kept as a cage bird. The head and back of the neck are scarlet, the throat is white, the back dark green varied with lighter green, and the breast yellow.
Roving: The act of one who roves or wanders.
&Verbar;Ravenala: A genus of plants related to the banana.
Reckoner: One who reckons or computes; also, a book of calculations, tables, etc., to assist in reckoning.
Recliner: One who, or that which, reclines.
Reluctant: Striving against; opposed in desire; unwilling; disinclined; loth.
Re\u00ebmbarkation: A putting, or going, on board a vessel again.
&Verbar;Roseola: A rose-colored efflorescence upon the skin, occurring in circumscribed patches of little or no elevation and often alternately fading and reviving; also, an acute specific disease which is characterized by an eruption of this character; -- called also rose rash.
Rosicrucian: Of or pertaining to the Rosicrucians, or their arts.
Rufous: Reddish; of a yellowish red or brownish red color; tawny.
Reboil: To boil, or to cause to boil, again.
Republicanize: To change, as a state, into a republic; to republican principles; as, France was republicanized; to republicanize the rising generation.
Reintegration: A renewing, or making whole again. See Redintegration.
Routine: A round of business, amusement, or pleasure, daily or frequently pursued; especially, a course of business or offical duties regularly or frequently returning.
Rebuttal: The giving of evidence on the part of a plaintiff to destroy the effect of evidence introduced by the defendant in the same suit.
Recalcitration: A kicking back again; opposition; repugnance; refractoriness.
Recurve: To curve in an opposite or unusual direction; to bend back or down.
Refashionment: The act of refashioning, or the state of being refashioned.
Retaliation: The act of retaliating, or of returning like for like; retribution; now, specifically, the return of evil for evil; e.g., an eye for an eye, a tooth for a tooth.
Reclusely: In a recluse or solitary manner.
Racing: a. & n. from Race, v. t. & i.
Rudimentary: Of or pertaining to rudiments; consisting in first principles; elementary; initial; as, rudimental essays.
Rearrange: To arrange again; to arrange in a different way.
Redeem: To purchase back; to regain possession of by payment of a stipulated price; to repurchase.
Renal-portal: Both renal and portal. See Portal.
Radicant: Taking root on, or above, the ground; rooting from the stem, as the trumpet creeper and the ivy.
Receptivity: The state or quality of being receptive.
Rectum: The terminal part of the large intestine; -- so named because supposed by the old anatomists to be straight. See Illust. under Digestive.
Reluct: To strive or struggle against anything; to make resistance; to draw back; to feel or show repugnance or reluctance.
&Verbar;Rostrulum: A little rostrum, or beak, as of an insect.
Recede: To cede back; to grant or yield again to a former possessor; as, to recede conquered territory.
Recital: The act of reciting; the repetition of the words of another, or of a document; rehearsal; as, the recital of testimony.
Record: A writing by which some act or event, or a number of acts or events, is recorded; a register; as, a record of the acts of the Hebrew kings; a record of the variations of temperature during a certain time; a family record.
Race suicide: The voluntary failure of the members of a race or people to have a number of children sufficient to keep the birth rate equal to the death rate.
Rix-dollar: A name given to several different silver coins of Denmark, Holland, Sweden,, NOrway, etc., varying in value from about 30 cents to $1.10; also, a British coin worth about 36 cents, used in Ceylon and at the Cape of Good Hope. See Rigsdaler, Riksdaler, and Rixdaler.
Reniform: Having the form or shape of a kidney; as, a reniform mineral; a reniform leaf.
&Verbar;Ramulus: A small branch, or branchlet, of corals, hydroids, and similar organisms.
Rooflet: A small roof, covering, or shelter.
Retromingency: The quality or state of being retromingent.
Ribbonman: A member of the Ribbon Society. See Ribbon Society, under Ribbon.
rotenone: A chemical substance (C23H22O6) extracted from the root of the derris (Derris elliptica, Derris malaccensis, and other species), used in treatment of scabies and as an insecticide for external infestation by chiggers in human medicine, and in veterinary medicine for the treatment of infestations with fleas, ticks, and lice.
Re-ferment: To ferment, or cause to ferment, again.
Recessed: Having a recess or recesses; as, a recessed arch or wall.
Recursant: Displayed with the back toward the spectator; -- said especially of an eagle.
Reeden: Consisting of a reed or reeds.
Reassociate: To associate again; to bring again into close relations.
Rubianic: pertaining to, or derived from, rubian; specifically, designating an acid called also ruberythrinic acid.
Rocking-stone: A stone, often of great size and weight, resting upon another stone, and so exactly poised that it can be rocked, or slightly moved, with but little force.
Resect: To cut or pare off; to remove by cutting.
&Verbar;Radio-flagellata: A group of Protozoa having both flagella and pseudopodia.
Rectilinearity: The quality or state of being rectilinear.
Ratel: Any carnivore of the genus Mellivora, allied to the weasels and the skunks; -- called also honey badger.
Royal: Printing and writing papers of particular sizes. See under paper, n.
Reliquidation: A second or renewed liquidation; a renewed adjustment.
Ruba-dub: The sound of a drum when continuously beaten; hence, a clamorous, repeated sound; a clatter.
Ribbonwood: A malvaceous tree (Hoheria populnea) of New Zealand, the bark of which is used for cordage.
Rhusma: A mixtire of caustic lime and orpiment, or tersulphide of arsenic, -- used in the depilation of hides.
Relic: That which remains; that which is left after loss or decay; a remaining portion; a remnant.
Revoice: To refurnish with a voice; to refit, as an organ pipe, so as to restore its tone.
Rigorist: One who is rigorous; -- sometimes applied to an extreme Jansenist.
Red-short: Hot-short; brittle when red-hot; -- said of certain kinds of iron.
Rigorism: Rigidity in principle or practice; strictness; -- opposed to laxity.
Rawhide: A cowhide, or coarse riding whip, made of untanned (or raw) hide twisted.
Reapportionment: A second or a new apportionment.
&Verbar;Raia: A genus of rays which includes the skates. See Skate.
Regalism: The doctrine of royal prerogative or supremacy.
Rightful: Righteous; upright; just; good; -- said of persons.
&Verbar;Rheum: A genus of plants. See Rhubarb.
Rodomel: Juice of roses mixed with honey.
Reclining: Bending or curving gradually back from the perpendicular.
Rip cord: A cord by which the gas bag of a balloon may be ripped open for a limited distance to release the gas quickly and so cause immediate descent.
Rattoon: To sprout or spring up from the root, as sugar cane from the root of the previous year's planting.
Ronchil: An American marine food fish (Bathymaster signatus) of the North Pacific coast, allied to the tilefish.
Repugnable: Capable of being repugned or resisted.
Re\u00ebntrant: Reëntering; pointing or directed inwardds; as, a re&unr_;ntrant angle.
Rustication: The act of rusticating, or the state of being rusticated; specifically, the punishment of a student for some offense, by compelling him to leave the institution for a time.
Rankness: The condition or quality of being rank.
Respondent: One who responds. It corresponds in general to defendant.
Remodify: To modify again or anew; to reshape.
Ricinic: Pertaining to, or derived from, castor oil; formerly, designating an acid now called ricinoleic acid.
Recognitory: Pertaining to, or connected with, recognition.
Retund: To blunt; to turn, as an edge; figuratively, to cause to be obtuse or dull; as, to retund confidence.
Retepore: Any one of several species of bryozoans of the genus Retepora. They form delicate calcareous corals, usually composed of thin fenestrated fronds.
Rolodex: A trade name for a type of card file; as, a Rolodex(R) card file.  Also used informally and improperly as a noun meaning Rolodex(R) card file.
Renitent: Resisting pressure or the effect of it; acting against impulse by elastic force.
Respirator: A divice of gauze or wire, covering the mouth or nose, to prevent the inhalation of noxious substances, as dust or smoke. Being warmed by the breath, it tempers cold air passing through it, and may also be used for the inhalation of medicated vapors.
Redouble: To become greatly or repeatedly increased; to be multiplied; to be greatly augmented; as, the noise redoubles.
Rulable: That may be ruled; subject to rule; accordant or conformable to rule.
Regulus: A petty king; a ruler of little power or consequence.
Roseal: resembling a rose in smell or color.
Remorse: The anguish, like gnawing pain, excited by a sense of guilt; compunction of conscience for a crime committed, or for the sins of one's past life.
&Verbar;Radiolaria: Order of rhizopods, usually having a siliceous skeleton, or shell, and sometimes radiating spicules. The pseudopodia project from the body like rays. It includes the polycystines. See Polycystina.
Rescission: The act of rescinding, abrogating, annulling, or vacating; as, the rescission of a law, decree, or judgment.
Ropes-end: To punish with a rope's end.
Regulation: The act of regulating, or the state of being regulated.
Retouch: A partial reworking,as of a painting, a sculptor's clay model, or the like.
Rosy: Resembling a rose in color, form, or qualities; blooming; red; blushing; also, adorned with roses.
Relaxative: Having the quality of relaxing; laxative.
Requicken: To quicken anew; to reanimate; to give new life to.
Roughscuff: A rough, coarse fellow; collectively, the lowest class of the people; the rabble; the riffraff.
Retiform: Composed of crossing lines and interstices; reticular; netlike; as, the retiform coat of the eye.
Regelate: To freeze together again; to undergo regelation, as ice.
Respite: To give or grant a respite to.
Romic: A method of notation for all spoken sounds, proposed by Mr. Sweet; -- so called because it is based on the common Roman-letter alphabet. It is like the palæotype of Mr. Ellis in the general plan, but simpler.
Ravehook: A tool, hooked at the end, for enlarging or clearing seams for the reception of oakum.
Renouncement: The act of disclaiming or rejecting; renunciation.
Remedial: Affording a remedy; intended for a remedy, or for the removal or abatement of an evil; as, remedial treatment.
Reticulose: Forming a network; characterized by a reticulated sructure.
Recarbonize: To restore carbon to; as, to recarbonize iron in converting it into steel.
Rouge: To tint with rouge; as, to rouge the face or the cheeks.
Roaring forties: The middle latitudes of the southern hemisphere. So called from the boisterous and prevailing westerly winds, which are especially strong in the South Indian Ocean up to 50° S.
Ruminator: One who ruminates or muses; a meditator.
Relict: A woman whose husband is dead; a widow.
Repay: To pay back; to refund; as, to repay money borrowed or advanced.
Rattleweed: Any plant of the genus Astragalus. See Milk vetch.
Rhizopodous: Of or pertaining to the rhizopods.
Ridiculosity: The quality or state of being ridiculous; ridiculousness; also, something ridiculous.
Ranine: Of or pertaining to the frogs and toads.
Rhodanate: A salt of rhodanic acid; a sulphocyanate.
radioactive: Capable of luminescence under the action of cathode rays, X rays, or any of the allied forms of radiation.
Radiator: That which radiates or emits rays, whether of light or heat; especially, that part of a heating apparatus from which the heat is radiated or diffused; as, a steam radiator.
Radicular: Of or pertaining to roots, or the root of a plant.
Ringer: A horse that is not entitled to take part in a race, but is fraudulently got into it.
Rubble: Water-worn or rough broken stones; broken bricks, etc., used in coarse masonry, or to fill up between the facing courses of walls.
Representativeness: The quality or state of being representative.
Resinate: Any one of the salts the resinic acids.
Re\u00ebnactment: The enacting or passing of a law a second time; the renewal of a law.
Railing: A barrier made of a rail or of rails, together with vertical supports.  The typical railing in the interior of structures or on porches has a horizontal rail near waist height, and multiple vertical supports.  Its function is usually to provide a safety barrier at the edge of a verticle drop to prevent falls.
Rampart: To surround or protect with, or as with, a rampart or ramparts.
Ricinolein: The glycerin salt of ricinoleic acid, occuring as a characteristic constituent of castor oil; -- formerly called palmin.
Redwing: A European thrush (Turdus iliacus). Its under wing coverts are orange red. Called also redwinged thrush. (b) A North American passerine bird (Agelarius phœniceus) of the family Icteridæ. The male is black, with a conspicuous patch of bright red, bordered with orange, on each wing. Called also redwinged blackbird, red-winged troupial, marsh blackbird, and swamp blackbird.
Relativeness: The state of being relative, or having relation; relativity.
Ringed: Encircled or marked with, or as with, a ring or rings.
Respirational: Of or pertaining to respiration; as, respirational difficulties.
Retinoic acid: A retinoid compound (C20H28O2), closely related to vitamin A.  It is also called tretinoin and vitamin A acid.
Redemptionist: A monk of an order founded in 1197; -- so called because the order was especially devoted to the redemption of Christians held in captivity by the Mohammedans. Called also Trinitarian.
Rounding: Small rope, or strands of rope, or spun yarn, wound round a rope to keep it from chafing; -- called also service.
Rheumatism: A general disease characterized by painful, often multiple, local inflammations, usually affecting the joints and muscles, but also extending sometimes to the deeper organs, as the heart.
Rabidly: In a rabid manner; with extreme violence.
Rehearse: To recite or repeat something for practice.
Rook: To cheat; to defraud by cheating.
Refutable: Admitting of being refuted or disproved; capable of being proved false or erroneous.
Rachitic: Of or pertaining to rachitis; affected by rachitis; rickety.
Recommend: To commend to the favorable notice of another; to commit to another's care, confidence, or acceptance, with favoring representations; to put in a favorable light before any one; to bestow commendation on; as, he recommended resting the mind and exercising the body.
Racovian: One of a sect of Socinians or Unitarians in Poland.
Retrogressive: Tending to retrograde; going or moving backward; declining from a better to a worse state.
Ramal: Of or pertaining to a ramus, or branch; rameal.
Rinser: One who, or that which, rinses.
Ramrod: The rod used in ramming home the charge in a muzzle-loading firearm.
&Verbar;Rhizotaxis: The arrangement of the roots of plants.
Roquet: To hit another's ball with one's own.
Reproducer: One who, or that which, reproduces.
Roebuck: A small European and Asiatic deer (Capreolus capræa) having erect, cylindrical, branched antlers, forked at the summit. This, the smallest European deer, is very nimble and graceful. It always prefers a mountainous country, or high grounds.
Restem: To force back against the current; as, to restem their backward course.
&Verbar;Rancho: A rude hut, as of posts, covered with branches or thatch, where herdsmen or farm laborers may live or lodge at night.
&Verbar;Reichsrath: The parliament of Austria (exclusive of Hungary, which has its own diet, or parliament). It consists of an Upper and a Lower House, or a House of Lords and a House of Representatives.
Representative: Fitted to represent; exhibiting a similitude.
Regimen: Orderly government; system of order; adminisration.
Rietboc: The reedbuck, a South African antelope (Cervicapra arundinacea); -- so called from its frequenting dry places covered with high grass or reeds. Its color is yellowish brown. Called also inghalla, and rietbok.
Rainbowed: Formed with or like a rainbow.
Refractive: Serving or having power to refract, or turn from a direct course; pertaining to refraction; as, refractive surfaces; refractive powers.
Resonant: Returning, or capable of returning, sound; fitted to resound; resounding; echoing back.
Raffish: Resembling, or having the character of, raff, or a raff; worthless; low.
Rewel bone: An obsolete phrase of disputed meaning, -- perhaps, smooth or polished bone.
Rudolphine: Pertaining to, or designating, a set of astronomical tables computed by Kepler, and founded on the observations of Tycho Brahe; -- so named from Rudolph II., emperor of Germany.
Readjust: To adjust or settle again; to put in a different order or relation; to rearrange.
Recreative: Tending to recreate or refresh; recreating; giving new vigor or animation; reinvigorating; giving relief after labor or pain; amusing; diverting.
Revibrate: To vibrate back or in return.
Repetition: The act of repeating; a doing or saying again; iteration.
Readdress: To address a second time; -- often used reflexively.
&Verbar;R\u00e2le: An adventitious sound, usually of morbid origin, accompanying the normal respiratory sounds. See Rhonchus.
Resupine: Lying on the back; supine; hence, careless.
&Verbar;Rhachiglossa: A division of marine gastropods having a retractile proboscis and three longitudinal rows of teeth on the radula. It includes many of the large ornamental shells, as the miters, murices, olives, purpuras, volutes, and whelks. See Illust. in the Appendix.
Rowan tree: A european tree (Pyrus aucuparia) related to the apple, but with pinnate leaves and flat corymbs of small white flowers followed by little bright red berries.  Called also roan tree, and mountain ash.  The name is also applied to two American trees of similar habit (Pyrus Americana, and Pyrus sambucifolia).
Reorganize: To organize again or anew; as, to reorganize a society or an army.
&Verbar;Rhizocephala: A division of Pectostraca including saclike parasites of Crustacea. They adhere by rootlike extensions of the head. See Illusration in Appendix.
Revivalism: The spirit of religious revivals; the methods of revivalists.
Refurnishment: The act of refurnishing, or state of being refurnished.
Rhododendron: A genus of shrubs or small trees, often having handsome evergreen leaves, and remarkable for the beauty of their flowers; rosebay.
Recognizability: The quality or condition of being recognizable.
Registering: Recording; -- applied to instruments; having an apparatus which registers; as, a registering thermometer. See Recording.
Roadside: Land adjoining a road or highway; the part of a road or highway that borders the traveled part. Also used ajectively.
Riprap: To form a riprap in or upon.
Restorable: Admitting of being restored; capable of being reclaimed; as, restorable land.
Revivalist: A clergyman or layman who promotes revivals of religion; an advocate for religious revivals; sometimes, specifically, a clergyman, without a particular charge, who goes about to promote revivals. Also used adjectively.
Rhodium: A rare element of the light platinum group. It is found in platinum ores, and obtained free as a white inert metal which it is very difficult to fuse. Symbol Rh. Atomic weight 104.1.  Specific gravity 12.
Rarebit: A dainty morsel; a Welsh rabbit. See Welsh rabbit, under Rabbit.
Re-collect: To collect again; to gather what has been scattered; as, to re-collect routed troops.
Rokeage: Parched Indian corn, pounded up and mixed with sugar; -- called also yokeage.
Reactionary: One who favors reaction, or seeks to undo political progress or revolution.
&Verbar;Rhizostomata: A suborder of Medusæ which includes very large species without marginal tentacles, but having large mouth lobes closely united at the edges. See Illust. in Appendix.
Recreancy: The quality or state of being recreant.
&Verbar;Radioli: The barbs of the radii of a feather; barbules.
Reseize: To seize again, or a second time.
&Verbar;Raku ware: A kind of earthenware made in Japan, resembling Satsuma ware, but having a paler color.
Recombination: Combination a second or additional time.
Reset: To harbor or secrete; to hide, as stolen goods or a criminal.
Ruffianly: Like a ruffian; bold in crimes; characteristic of a ruffian; violent; brutal.
Rose-colored: Having the color of a pink rose; rose-pink; of a delicate pink color.
Reviewer: One who reviews or reëxamines; an inspector; one who examines publications critically, and publishes his opinion upon their merits; a professional critic of books.
Rosefinch: Any one of numerous species of Asiatic finches of the genera Carpodacus, and Propasser, and allied genera, in which the male is more or less colored with rose red.
Rh\u00e6tic: Pertining to, or of the same horizon as, certain Mesozoic strata of the Rhetian Alps. These strata are regarded as closing the Triassic period. See the Chart of Geology.
Retch: To care for; to heed; to reck.
Reprobative: Of or pertaining to reprobation; expressing reprobation.
Rubidium: A rare metallic element of the alkali metal series, atomic number 37. It occurs quite widely, but in small quantities, and always combined. It is isolated as a soft yellowish white metal, analogous to potassium in most of its properties.  Symbol Rb.  Atomic weight, 85.48.
Republication: A second publication, or a new publication of something before published, as of a former will, of a volume already published, or the like; specifically, the publication in one country of a work first issued in another; a reprint.
Resolvability: The quality or condition of being resolvable; resolvableness.
Reafforest: To convert again into a forest, as a region of country.
Rubiaceous: Of or pertaining to a very large natural order of plants (Rubiaceæ) named after the madder (Rubia tinctoria), and including about three hundred and seventy genera and over four thousand species. Among them are the coffee tree, the trees yielding peruvian bark and quinine, the madder, the quaker ladies, and the trees bearing the edible fruits called genipap and Sierre Leone peach, besides many plants noted for the beauty or the fragrance of their blossoms.
Reactance: The influence of a coil of wire upon an alternating current passing through it, tending to choke or diminish the current, or the similar influence of a condenser; inductive resistance. Reactance is measured in ohms. The reactance of a circuit is equal to the component of the impressed electro-motive force at right angles to the current divided by the current, that is, the component of the impedance due to the self-inductance or capacity of the circuit.
Ropily: In a ropy manner; in a viscous or glutinous manner.
Rhinophore: One of the two tentacle-like organs on the back of the head or neck of a nudibranch or tectibranch mollusk. They are usually retractile, and often transversely furrowed or plicate, and are regarded as olfactory organs. Called also dorsal tentacles. See Illust.  under Pygobranchia, and Opisthobranchia.
Revisal: The act of revising, or reviewing and reëxamining for correction and improvement; revision; as, the revisal of a manuscript; the revisal of a proof sheet; the revisal of a treaty.
Rynd: A piece of iron crossing the hole in the upper millstone by which the stone is supported on the spindle.
Reland: To go on shore after having embarked; to land again.
Ransom: To redeem from captivity, servitude, punishment, or forfeit, by paying a price; to buy out of servitude or penalty; to rescue; to deliver; as, to ransom prisoners from an enemy.
Rollway: A place prepared for rolling logs into a stream.
Rhythmics: The department of musical science which treats of the length of sounds.
Renverse: Reversed; set with the head downward; turned contrary to the natural position.
Recoilingly: In the manner of a recoil.
Rackabones: A very lean animal, esp. a horse.
Recapacitate: To qualify again; to confer capacity on again.
Refrigeration: The act or process of refrigerating or cooling, or the state of being cooled.
Riverside: The side or bank of a river.
&Verbar;Ranz des vaches: The name for numerous simple, but very irregular, melodies of the Swiss mountaineers, blown on a long tube called the Alpine horn, and sometimes sung.
Roundhouse: A constable's prison; a lockup, watch-house, or station house.
Repossess: To possess again; as, to repossess the land.
Revolutioner: One who is engaged in effecting a revolution; a revolutionist.
Reamer: One who, or that which, reams; specifically, an instrument with cutting or scraping edges, used, with a twisting motion, for enlarging a round hole, as the bore of a cannon, etc.
Replenishment: The act of replenishing, or the state of being replenished.
Retinal: A retinoid compound (C20H28O), closely related to vitamin A, which is a component of the visual pigments in the eye.  It is also called retinaldehyde and vitamin A aldehyde.
Rack: To extend by the application of force; to stretch or strain; specifically, to stretch on the rack or wheel; to torture by an engine which strains the limbs and pulls the joints.
Rindle: A small water course or gutter.
Refringency: The power possessed by a substance to refract a ray; as, different substances have different refringencies.
Retiracy: Retirement; -- mostly used in a jocose or burlesque way.
Ringbone: A morbid growth or deposit of bony matter between or on the small pastern and the great pastern bones.
Reclination: The act of leaning or reclining, or the state of being reclined.
Rundle: A round; a step of a ladder; a rung.
Retroflexion: The act of reflexing; the state of being retroflexed.  Cf. Retroversion.
Rhabdomere: One of the several parts composing a rhabdom.
Reversing: Serving to effect reversal, as of motion; capable of being reversed.
Rueful: Causing one to rue or lament; woeful; mournful; sorrowful.
Rhetorize: To represent by a figure of rhetoric, or by personification.
Raving: Talking irrationally and wildly; as, a raving lunatic.
Remold: To mold or shape anew or again; to reshape.
Ripping panel: A long patch, on a balloon, to be ripped off, by the rip cord, at landing, in order to allow the immediate escape of gas and instant deflation of the bag.
Rereward: The rear guard of an army.
Remembrancer: One who, or that which, serves to bring to, or keep in, mind; a memento; a memorial; a reminder.
Redoubt: To stand in dread of; to regard with fear; to dread.
Rotograph: A photograph printed by a process in which a strip or roll of sensitized paper is automatically fed over the negative so that a series of prints are made, and are then developed, fixed, cut apart, and washed at a very rapid rate.
Restorative: Something which serves to restore; especially, a restorative medicine.
Renown: To make famous; to give renown to.
Rattlebox: A toy that makes a rattling sound; a rattle.
Rumor: To report by rumor; to tell.
Repetitional: Of the nature of, or containing, repetition.
Resemblingly: So as to resemble; with resemblance or likeness.
Retractile: Capable of retraction; capable of being drawn back or up; as, the claws of a cat are retractile.
Refel: To refute; to disprove; as, to refel the tricks of a sophister.
R\u00f6ntgenize: To render (air or other gas) conducting by the passage of Röntgen rays.
Rendrock: A kind of dynamite used in blasting.
&Verbar;Rayah: A person not a Mohammedan, who pays the capitation tax.
Rumper: A member or a supporter of the Rump Parliament.
Realizing: Serving to make real, or to impress on the mind as a reality; as, a realizing view of the danger incurred.
Recurrent: Returning from time to time; recurring; as, recurrent pains.
Ragweed: A common American composite weed (Ambrosia artemisiæfolia) with finely divided leaves; hogweed.
Reechy: Smoky; reeky; hence, begrimed with dirt.
Robber: One who robs; in law, one who feloniously takes goods or money from the person of another by violence or by putting him in fear.
Redsear: To be brittle when red-hot; to be red-short.
Resignation: The act of resigning or giving up, as a claim, possession, office, or the like; surrender; as, the resignation of a crown or commission.
Refer: To have recourse; to apply; to appeal; to betake one's self; as, to refer to a dictionary.
Rhodian: Of or pertaining to Rhodes, an island of the Mediterranean.
Roll: The act of rolling, or state of being rolled; as, the roll of a ball; the roll of waves.
Reneye: To deny; to reject; to renounce.
Re\u00ebligible: Eligible again; capable of reëlection; as, reëligible to the same office.
&Verbar;Referendum: A diplomatic agent's note asking for instructions from his government concerning a particular matter or point.
Remediless: Not admitting of a remedy; incapable of being restored or corrected; incurable; irreparable; as, a remediless mistake or loss.
Ruche: A plaited, quilled, or goffered strip of lace, net, ribbon, or other material, -- used in place of collars or cuffs, and as a trimming for women's dresses and bonnets.
Relentment: The act or process of relenting; the state of having relented.
Rhymester: A rhymer; a maker of poor poetry.
&Verbar;Ritardando: Retarding; -- a direction for slower time; rallentado.
Readiness: The state or quality of being ready; preparation; promptness; aptitude; willingness.
&Verbar;Rhinitis: Inflammation of the nose; esp., inflammation of the mucous membrane of the nostrils.
Rasure: The act of rasing, scraping, or erasing; erasure; obliteration.
Refringent: Pertaining to, or possessing, refringency; refractive; refracting; as, a refringent prism of spar.
&Verbar;Rugosa: An extinct tribe of fossil corals, including numerous species, many of them of large size.  They are characteristic of the Paleozoic formations. The radiating septs, when present, are usually in multiples of four.  See Cyathophylloid.
Rucervine: Of, like, or pertaining to, a deer of the genus Rucervus, which includes the swamp deer of India.
Reappearance: A second or new appearance; the act or state of appearing again.
Residuum: That which is left after any process of separation or purification; that which remains after certain specified deductions are made; residue.
Riffraff: Sweepings; refuse; the lowest order of society.
Repartee: To make smart and witty replies.
Rend: To be rent or torn; to become parted; to separate; to split.
&Verbar;Robinia: A genus of leguminous trees including the common locust of North America (Robinia Pseudocacia).
Recapitulate: To sum up, or enumerate by heads or topics, what has been previously said; to repeat briefly the substance.
Rutterkin: An old crafty fox or beguiler -- a word of contempt.
Rhabdolith: A minute calcareous rodlike structure found both at the surface and the bottom of the ocean; -- supposed by some to be a calcareous alga.
Refound: imp. & p. p. of Refind, v. t.
Relatively: In a relative manner; in relation or respect to something else; not absolutely.
Revocation: The act of calling back, or the state of being recalled; recall.
Reimport: To import again; to import what has been exported; to bring back.
Rutin: A glucoside resembling, but distinct from, quercitrin.  Rutin is found in the leaves of the rue (Ruta graveolens) and other plants, and obtained as a bitter yellow crystalline substance which yields quercitin on decomposition.
Restringe: To confine; to contract; to stringe.
Reticulation: The quality or state of being reticulated, or netlike; that which is reticulated; network; an organization resembling a net.
Reduction: The act of reducing, or state of being reduced; conversion to a given state or condition; diminution; conquest; as, the reduction of a body to powder; the reduction of things to order; the reduction of the expenses of government; the reduction of a rebellious province.
Rhinocerotic: Of or pertaining to the rhinoceros.
Repute: Character reputed or attributed; reputation, whether good or bad; established opinion; public estimate.
&Verbar;rubella: An acute but mild viral infection characterized by a dusky red cutaneous eruption resembling that of measles, but attended by only mild respiratory problems or fever; -- called also German measles.  The infective virus is called Rubella virus, or Rubivirus. If contracted by a woman during the first several months of pregnancy, rubella may cause serious abnormalities in the fetus.
Reckless: Inattentive to duty; careless; neglectful; indifferent.
Reverie: A loose or irregular train of thought occurring in musing or mediation; deep musing; daydream.
Rigid: Firm; stiff; unyielding; not pliant; not flexible.
Rolley: A small wagon used for the underground work of a mine.
Redemptory: Paid for ransom; serving to redeem.
Rhapsody: A recitation or song of a rhapsodist; a portion of an epic poem adapted for recitation, or usually recited, at one time; hence, a division of the Iliad or the Odyssey; -- called also a book.
Reprint: A second or a new impression or edition of any printed work; specifically, the publication in one country of a work previously published in another.
Roller: One who, or that which, rolls; especially, a cylinder, sometimes grooved, of wood, stone, metal, etc., used in husbandry and the arts.
Ramify: To shoot, or divide, into branches or subdivisions, as the stem of a plant.
Rampage: To leap or prance about, as an animal; to be violent; to rage.
Rhamnaceous: Of or pertaining to a natural order of shrubs and trees (Rhamnaceæ, or Rhamneæ) of which the buckthorn (Rhamnus) is the type. It includes also the New Jersey tea, the supple-jack, and one of the plants called lotus (Zizyphus).
Roundaboutness: The quality of being roundabout; circuitousness.
Relicted: Left uncovered, as land by recession of water.
Rosebush: The bush or shrub which bears roses.
Radon: An intensely radioactive gaseous element produced by the radioactive decay of radium-226, which is the main isotope of radium found in pitchblende.  Chemically it is an inert noble gas.  Its atomic symbol is Rn. It has an atomic number of 86.  The radon isotope produced by decay of radium has an atomic weight of 222.017, and this isotope decays by alpha emission with a half-life of 3.82 days.  Numerous other isotopes have been observed, all radioactive and all having half-lives shorter than that of radon-222.  Radon was discovered by M. and Mme. Curie, of Paris, in their studies of the radioactive substances in pitchblende.  Radon was originally called  radium emanation or exradio.
Regulator: One who, or that which, regulates.
Rulingly: In a ruling manner; so as to rule.
Ringbird: The reed bunting. It has a collar of white feathers. Called also ring bunting.
Raised: Lifted up; showing above the surroundings; as, raised or embossed metal work.
Recensionist: One who makes recensions; specifically, a critical editor.
Ringmaster: One in charge of the performances (as of horses) within the ring in a circus.
Ratify: To approve and sanction; to make valid; to confirm; to establish; to settle; especially, to give sanction to, as something done by an agent or servant; as, to ratify an agreement, treaty, or contract; to ratify a nomination.
Rounder: One who rounds; one who comes about frequently or regularly.
Rivulet: A small stream or brook; a streamlet.
Revet: To face, as an embankment, with masonry, wood, or other material.
Raiser: One who, or that which, raises (in various senses of the verb).
Remodel: To model or fashion anew; to change the form of.
Recognition: The act of recognizing, or the state of being recognized; acknowledgment; formal avowal; knowledge confessed or avowed; notice.
Recharge: To charge or accuse in return.
Redditive: Answering to an interrogative or inquiry; conveying a reply; as, redditive words.
Rotator: that which gives a rotary or rolling motion, as a muscle which partially rotates or turns some part on its axis.
Receivability: The quality of being receivable; receivableness.
Racemose: Resembling a raceme; growing in the form of a raceme; as, (Bot.) racemose berries or flowers; (Anat.) the racemose glands, in which the ducts are branched and clustered like a raceme.
Revive: To restore, or bring again to life; to reanimate.
Ruptuary: One not of noble blood; a plebeian; a roturier.
&Verbar;Rhamphorhynchus: A genus of pterodactyls in which the elongated tail supported a leathery expansion at the tip.
Responsory: The answer of the people to the priest in alternate speaking, in church service.
Romantic: Of or pertaining to romance; involving or resembling romance; hence, fanciful; marvelous; extravagant; unreal; as, a romantic tale; a romantic notion; a romantic undertaking.
Reinforced concrete: Concrete having within its mass a system of iron or steel supports, such as bars, rods, or a heavy mesh, to provide increased tensile strength and shear resistance.  Same as Ferro-concrete.
Robin Goodfellow: A celebrated fairy; Puck. See Puck.
Raw: A raw, sore, or galled place; a sensitive spot; as, to touch one on the raw.
Radiometry: The use of the radiometer, or the measurement of radiation.
Re-ally: To bring together again; to compose or form anew.
Restagnate: To stagnate; to cease to flow.
Rake: To walk about; to gad or ramble idly.
Rullichies: Chopped meat stuffed into small bags of tripe. They are cut in slices and fried.
Recreant: One who yields in combat, and begs for mercy; a mean-spirited, cowardly wretch.
Risorial: Pertaining to, or producing, laughter; as, the risorial muscles.
&Verbar;Reptilia: A class of air-breathing oviparous vertebrates, usually covered with scales or bony plates. The heart generally has two auricles and one ventricle. The development of the young is the same as that of birds.
Refugee: One who flees to a shelter, or place of safety.
Replete: To fill completely, or to satiety.
Residentiaryship: The office or condition of a residentiary.
Redub: To refit; to repair, or make reparation for; hence, to repay or requite.
Reproachful: Expressing or containing reproach; upbraiding; opprobrious; abusive.
Relief: The act of relieving, or the state of being relieved; the removal, or partial removal, of any evil, or of anything oppressive or burdensome, by which some ease is obtained; succor; alleviation; comfort; ease; redress.
R\u00e9aumur: Of or pertaining to René Antoine Ferchault de Réaumur; conformed to the scale adopted by Réaumur in graduating the thermometer he invented.
Rapper: One who, or that which, raps or knocks; specifically, the knocker of a door.
Relbun: The roots of the Chilian plant Calceolaria arachnoidea, -- used for dyeing crimson.
Ramequin: A mixture of cheese, eggs, etc., formed in a mold, or served on bread.
&Verbar;Ruminantia: A division of Artiodactyla having four stomachs. This division includes the camels, deer, antelopes, goats, sheep, neat cattle, and allies.
Rapped: imp. & p. p. of Rap, to snatch away.
Rappee: A pungent kind of snuff made from the darker and ranker kinds of tobacco leaves.
Repudiation: One who favors repudiation, especially of a public debt.
Runghead: The upper end of a floor timber in a ship.
Restriction: The act of restricting, or state of being restricted; confinement within limits or bounds.
radiography: Art or process of making radiographs, radiograms, or autoradiograms.
Revenue: That which returns, or comes back, from an investment; the annual rents, profits, interest, or issues of any species of property, real or personal; income.
Radium: An intensely radioactive metallic element found (combined) in minute quantities in pitchblende, and various other uranium minerals. Symbol, Ra; atomic weight, 226.4.  Radium was discovered by M. and Mme. Curie, of Paris, who in 1902 separated compounds of it by a tedious process from pitchblende.  Its compounds color flames carmine and give a characteristic spectrum.  It is divalent, resembling barium chemically.  The main isotope of radium found in pitchblende, radium-226, has a half-life of 1620 years, decaying first by alpha emission to radon.
Reductibility: The quality of being reducible; reducibleness.
Radius: A right line drawn or extending from the center of a circle to the periphery; the semidiameter of a circle or sphere.
&Verbar;Rataplan: The iterative sound of beating a drum, or of a galloping horse.
Re\u00ebdification: The act reëdifying; the state of being reëdified.
Revealer: One who, or that which, reveals.
Red Cross: The crusaders or the cause they represented.
Reforest: To replant with trees; to reafforest; to reforestize.
&Verbar;Ripieno: Filling up; supplementary; supernumerary; -- a term applied to those instruments which only swell the mass or tutti of an orchestra, but are not obbligato.
Rondo: A composition, vocal or instrumental, commonly of a lively, cheerful character, in which the first strain recurs after each of the other strains.
Rotalite: Any fossil foraminifer of the genus Rotalia, abundant in the chalk formation. See Illust. under Rhizopod.
Rescription: A writing back; the answering of a letter.
Reinstate: To place again in possession, or in a former state; to restore to a state from which one had been removed; to instate again; as, to reinstate a king in the possession of the kingdom.
rap music: a type of rhythmic talking, often with accompanying rhythm instruments; same as 7th rap, n..
Rhematic: The doctrine of propositions or sentences.
Rectifier: One who, or that which, rectifies.
Rumination: The act or process of ruminating, or chewing the cud; the habit of chewing the cud.
Remittent: Remitting; characterized by remission; having remissions.
Rumble: To cause to pass through a rumble, or shaking machine. See Rumble, n., 4.
Regalia: A kind of cigar of large size and superior quality; also, the size in which such cigars are classed.
Rose: To render rose-colored; to redden; to flush.
&Verbar;Raca: A term of reproach used by the Jews of our Savior's time, meaning “worthless.”
Rusticate: To require or compel to reside in the country; to banish or send away temporarily; to impose rustication on.
Roadbed: In railroads, the bed or foundation on which the superstructure (ties, rails, etc.) rests; in common roads, the whole material laid in place and ready for travel.
Resolved: Having a fixed purpose; determined; resolute; -- usually placed after its noun; as, a man resolved to be rich.
Recompensive: Of the nature of recompense; serving to recompense.
Remember: To execise or have the power of memory; as, some remember better than others.
Rheostat: A contrivance for adjusting or regulating the strength of electrical currents, operating usually by the intercalation of resistance which can be varied at will.
Roxburgh: A style of bookbinding in which the back is plain leather, the sides paper or cloth, the top gilt-edged, but the front and bottom left uncut.
Rayonnant: Darting forth rays, as the sun when it shines out.
Ragged: Rent or worn into tatters, or till the texture is broken; as, a ragged coat; a ragged sail.
Red-tape: Pertaining to, or characterized by, official formality. See Red tape, under Red, a.
Redevelopment: the rebuilding of an urban area, usually a commercial district but sometimes residential or industrial, and typically involving some portion of government involvement and expenditure; to organize a municipal redevelopment agency.
Raffia: A fibrous material used for tying plants, said to come from the leaves of a palm tree of the genus Raphia.
Remodification: The act of remodifying; the state of being remodified.
Reparable: Capable of being repaired, restored to a sound or good state, or made good; restorable; as, a reparable injury.
&Verbar;Repartimiento: A partition or distribution, especially of slaves; also, an assessment of taxes.
Revocable: Capable of being revoked; as, a revocable edict or grant; a revocable covenant.
Rombowline: Old, condemned canvas, rope, etc., unfit for use except in chafing gear.
Righteously: In a righteous manner; as, to judge righteously.
Rosemaloes: The liquid storax of the East Indian Liquidambar orientalis.
Reverberator: One who, or that which, produces reverberation.
&Verbar;Regularia: A division of Echini which includes the circular, or regular, sea urchins.
Rankly: With rank or vigorous growth; luxuriantly; hence, coarsely; grossly; as, weeds grow rankly.
Resistance: The act of resisting; opposition, passive or active.
Rectifiable: Capable of being rectified; as, a rectifiable mistake.
Rankle: To cause to fester; to make sore; to inflame.
Ream: To bevel out, as the mouth of a hole in wood or metal; in modern usage, to enlarge or dress out, as a hole, with a reamer.
Recuperation: Recovery, as of anything lost, especially of the health or strength.
Retrospect: A looking back on things past; view or contemplation of the past.
Recusancy: The state of being recusant; nonconformity.
Read: Instructed or knowing by reading; versed in books; learned.
Rhinolophid: Any species of the genus Rhinilophus, or family Rhinolophidæ, having a horseshoe-shaped nasal crest; a horseshoe bat.
Rampageous: Characterized by violence and passion; unruly; rampant.
Reannex: To annex again or anew; to reunite.
Ricinoleic: Pertaining to, or designating, a fatty acid analogous to oleic acid, obtained from castor oil as an oily substance, C18H34O3 with a harsh taste. Formerly written ricinolic and formerly referred to as palmic.
React: To return an impulse or impression; to resist the action of another body by an opposite force; as, every body reacts on the body that impels it from its natural state.
Ratable: Capable of being rated, or set at a certain value.
Reformation: The act of reforming, or the state of being reformed; change from worse to better; correction or amendment of life, manners, or of anything vicious or corrupt; as, the reformation of manners; reformation of the age; reformation of abuses.
Roarer: One who, or that which, roars.
Rack-renter: One who is subjected to paying rack-rent.
Ross: To divest of the ross, or rough, scaly surface; as, to ross bark.
Reap: A bundle of grain; a handful of grain laid down by the reaper as it is cut.
Relish: The projection or shoulder at the side of, or around, a tenon, on a tenoned piece.
Rear: To rise up on the hind legs, as a horse; to become erect.
Roynish: Mangy; scabby; hence, mean; paltry; troublesome.
Rectal: Of or pertaining to the rectum; in the region of the rectum.
Rotary: Turning, as a wheel on its axis; pertaining to, or resembling, the motion of a wheel on its axis; rotatory; as, rotary motion.
Reload: To load again, as a gun.
Rapture: To transport with excitement; to enrapture.
Reloan: A second lending of the same thing; a renewal of a loan.
Rehabilitation: The act of rehabilitating, or the state of being rehabilitated.
Recoverable: Capable of being recovered or regained; capable of being brought back to a former condition, as from sickness, misfortune, etc.; obtainable from a debtor or possessor; as, the debt is recoverable; goods lost or sunk in the ocean are not recoverable.
Regenerator: One who, or that which, regenerates.
Retiped: A bird having small polygonal scales covering the tarsi.
Reciprocornous: Having horns turning backward and then forward, like those of a ram.
Riparian: Of or pertaining to the bank of a river; as, riparian rights.
Rabbi: Master; lord; teacher; -- a Jewish title of respect or honor for a teacher or doctor of the law.
Rectory: The province of a rector; a parish church, parsonage, or spiritual living, with all its rights, tithes, and glebes.
Rhigolene: A mixture of volatile hydrocarbons intermediate between gsolene and cymogene. It is obtained in the purification of crude petroleum, and is used as a refregerant.
Receivers certificate: An acknowledgement of indebtedness made by a receiver under order of court to obtain funds for the preservation of the assets held by him, as for operating a railroad. Receivers' certificates are ordinarily a first lien on the assets, prior to that of bonds or other securities.
Rationalness: The quality or state of being rational; rationality.
Redwithe: A west Indian climbing shrub (Combretum Jacquini) with slender reddish branchlets.
&Verbar;Rallentando: Slackening; -- a direction to perform a passage with a gradual decrease in time and force; ritardando.
Refundment: The act of refunding; also, that which is refunded.
Refrigerant: That which makes to be cool or cold; specifically, a medicine or an application for allaying fever, or the symptoms of fever; -- used also figuratively.
Reclusory: The habitation of a recluse; a hermitage.
Remissory: Serving or tending to remit, or to secure remission; remissive.
Rationalization: The act or process of rationalizing.
Reservatory: A place in which things are reserved or kept.
Replantation: The act of planting again; a replanting.
Romanticness: The state or quality of being romantic; widness; fancifulness.
Recto-: A combining form indicating connection with, or relation to, the rectum; as, recto-vesical.
Recluseness: Quality or state of being recluse.
Round: To grow round or full; hence, to attain to fullness, completeness, or perfection.
Recitation: The act of reciting; rehearsal; repetition of words or sentences.
Ricker: A stout pole for use in making a rick, or for a spar to a boat.
Resurrection: A rising again; the resumption of vigor.
Regrowth: The act of regrowing; a second or new growth.
Rotundity: The state or quality of being rotu&unr_;; roundness; sphericity; circularity.
&Verbar;Ruga: A wrinkle; a fold; as, the rugæ of the stomach.
Rubiacin: A substance found in madder root, and probably identical with ruberythrinic acid.
Ravish: To seize and carry away by violence; to snatch by force.
Retort: The return of, or reply to, an argument, charge, censure, incivility, taunt, or witticism; a quick and witty or severe response.
Reanswer: To answer in return; to repay; to compensate; to make amends for.
Revolve: To cause to turn, as on an axis.
Rush-bearing: A kind of rural festival at the dedication of a church, when the parishioners brought rushes to strew the church.
Renardine: Of or pertaining to Renard, the fox, or the tales in which Renard is mentioned.
Retire: The act of retiring, or the state of being retired; also, a place to which one retires.
Rest: To be left; to remain; to continue to be.
Rubidic: Of or pertaining to rubidium; containing rubidium.
Raking: The act or process of using a rake; the going over a space with a rake.
Re-sign: To affix one's signature to, a second time; to sign again.
Rangle: To range about in an irregular manner.
Ring: To rise in the air spirally.
Rarely: In a rare manner or degree; seldom; not often; as, things rarely seen.
&Verbar;Remittitur: A remission or surrender, -- remittitur damnut being a remission of excess of damages.
Rese: To shake; to quake; to tremble.
Rettery: A place or establishment where flax is retted. See Ret.
Reanimate: To animate anew; to restore to animation or life; to infuse new life, vigor, spirit, or courage into; to revive; to reinvigorate; as, to reanimate a drowned person; to reanimate disheartened troops; to reanimate languid spirits.
Ruberythrinic: Pertaining to, or designating, an acid extracted from madder root. It is a yellow crystalline substance from which alizarin is obtained.
Restrain: To draw back again; to hold back from acting, proceeding, or advancing, either by physical or moral force, or by any interposing obstacle; to repress or suppress; to keep down; to curb.
Round-shouldered: Having the shoulders stooping or projecting; round-backed.
Recessional: Of or pertaining to recession or withdrawal.
Robe: To invest with a robe or robes; to dress; to array; as, fields robed with green.
R\u00f6ntgen ray: An X-ray; originally, the term was applied to any of the rays produced when cathode rays strike upon surface of a solid (as the wall of the vacuum tube), but now it refers specifically to electromagnetic radiation having wavelengths from 10-3 nm to 10 nm, immediately below ultraviolet radiation on the wavelength scale.  Röntgen rays are noted for their penetration of opaque substances, as wood and flesh, their action on photographic plates, and their fluorescent effects.  They were called X rays by their discoverer, W. K. Röntgen.  They are one of the forms of ionizing radiation, which can have damaging effects on living cells.  They also ionize gases, but cannot be reflected, or polarized, or deflected by a magnetic field.  They are used in examining opaque objects, especially in medicine for visualizing organs and other objects inside the human body, as for locating fractures or bullets, and examining internal organs for abnormalities.
Red-letter: Of or pertaining to a red letter; marked by red letters.
&Verbar;Raghuvansa: A celebrated Sanskrit poem having for its subject the Raghu dynasty.
Releaser: One who releases, or sets free.
Restraint: The act or process of restraining, or of holding back or hindering from motion or action, in any manner; hindrance of the will, or of any action, physical or mental.
Resuscitant: One who, or that which resuscitates. Also used adjectively.
Rawboned: Having little flesh on the bones; gaunt.
Regicide: One who kills or who murders a king; specifically (Eng. Hist.), one of the judges who condemned Charles I. to death.
Revocability: The quality of being revocable; as, the revocability of a law.
Releasee: One to whom a release is given.
Rotation: Pertaining to, or resulting from, rotation; of the nature of, or characterized by, rotation; as, rotational velocity.
Roberdsman: A bold, stout robber, or night thief; -- said to be so called from Robin Hood.
Retroflex: Reflexed; bent or turned abruptly backward.
Resistible: Capable of being resisted; as, a resistible force.
Ramose: Branched, as the stem or root of a plant; having lateral divisions; consisting of, or having, branches; full of branches; ramifying; branching; branchy.
Rhetoric: The art of composition; especially, elegant composition in prose.
Repace: To pace again; to walk over again in a contrary direction.
Reproductive: Tending, or pertaining, to reproduction; employed in reproduction.
Repack: To pack a second time or anew; as, to repack beef; to repack a trunk.
Rechange: To change again, or change back.
Rhinoplasty: Plastic surgery of the nose to correct deformity or to replace lost tissue. Tissue may be transplanted from the patient's cheek, forehead, arm, etc., or even from another person.
Rhodopsin: The visual purple. See under Visual.
Reminiscence: The act or power of recalling past experience; the state of being reminiscent; remembrance; memory.
Rubiginose: Having the appearance or color of iron rust; rusty-looking.
Riptowel: A gratuity given to tenants after they had reaped their lord's corn.
Rhythmer: One who writes in rhythm, esp. in poetic rhythm or meter.
Romeine: A mineral of a hyacinth or honey-yellow color, occuring in square octahedrons. It is an antimonate of calcium.
&Verbar;Ralli\u00e9s: A French political group, also known as the Constitutional Right from its position in the Chambers, mainly monarchists who rallied to the support of the Republic in obedience to the encyclical put forth by Pope Leo XIII. in Feb., 1892.
&Verbar;Rota: An ecclesiastical court of Rome, called also Rota Romana, that takes cognizance of suits by appeal. It consists of twelve members.
Reliant: Having, or characterized by, reliance; confident; trusting.
Rugine: To scrape or rasp, as a bone; to scale.
Razorbill: A species of auk (Alca torda) common in the Arctic seas. See Auk, and Illust. in Appendix.
Rectification: The act or operation of rectifying; as, the rectification of an error; the rectification of spirits.
Runer: A bard, or learned man, among the ancient Goths.
Reseminate: To produce again by means of seed.
Redfish: The blueback salmon of the North Pacific; -- called also nerka. See Blueback (b).
Resipiscence: Wisdom derived from severe experience; hence, repentance.
&Verbar;Roture: The condition of being a roturier.
&Verbar;Railleur: A banterer; a jester; a mocker.
&Verbar;Rasante: Sweeping; grazing; -- applied to a style of fortification in which the command of the works over each other, and over the country, is kept very low, in order that the shot may more effectually sweep or graze the ground before them.
Rump-fed: A Shakespearean word of uncertain meaning.  Perhaps “fattened in the rump, pampered.”
Rosetta wood: An east Indian wood of a reddish orange color, handsomely veined with darker marks. It is occasionally used for cabinetwork.
Rescue: To free or deliver from any confinement, violence, danger, or evil; to liberate from actual restraint; to remove or withdraw from a state of exposure to evil; as, to rescue a prisoner from the enemy; to rescue seamen from destruction.
Reckling: Needing care; weak; feeble; as, a reckling child.
Reform: Amendment of what is defective, vicious, corrupt, or depraved; reformation; as, reform of elections; reform of government.
Rootcap: A mass of parenchymatous cells which covers and protects the growing cells at the end of a root; a pileorhiza.
Retroact: To act backward, or in return; to act in opposition; to be retrospective.
Reversely: In a reverse manner; on the other hand; on the opposite.
Realization: The act of realizing, or the state of being realized.
Retromingent: Organized so as to discharge the urine backward.
Ruble: The unit of monetary value in Russia.  It is divided into 100 copecks, and in the gold coin of the realm (as in the five and ten ruble pieces) is worth about 77 cents. The silver ruble is a coin worth about 60 cents.
Rote: To go out by rotation or succession; to rotate.
Retractor: One who, or that which, retracts.
Rubefaction: The act or process of making red.
&Verbar;Rhipidoglossa: A division of gastropod mollusks having a large number of long, divergent, hooklike, lingual teeth in each transverse row. It includes the scutibranchs. See Illustration in Appendix.
Requital: The act of requiting; also, that which requites; return, good or bad, for anything done; in a good sense, compensation; recompense; as, the requital of services; in a bad sense, retaliation, or punishment; as, the requital of evil deeds.
Russian: Of or pertaining to Russia, its inhabitants, or language.
R\u00fcdesheimer: A German wine made near Rüdesheim, on the Rhine.
Republicate: To make public again; to republish.
Rename: To give a new name to.
Ratlines: The small transverse ropes attached to the shrouds and forming the steps of a rope ladder.
Roomer: At a greater distance; farther off.
Resemble: To be like or similar to; to bear the similitude of, either in appearance or qualities; as, these brothers resemble each other.
Release: The act of letting loose or freeing, or the state of being let loose or freed; liberation or discharge from restraint of any kind, as from confinement or bondage.
Ranal: Having a general affinity to ranunculaceous plants.
Retinalite: A translucent variety of serpentine, of a honey yellow or greenish yellow color, having a waxy resinlike luster.
Ratting: The conduct or practices of one who rats.  See Rat, v. i., 1.
Recognizee: The person in whose favor a recognizance is made.
Restiness: The quality or state of being resty; sluggishness.
&Verbar;Rurales: The gossamer-winged butterflies; a family of small butterflies, including the hairstreaks, violets, and theclas.
Representation: The act of representing, in any sense of the verb.
Rehash: Something hashed over, or made up from old materials.
Ruminant: A ruminant animal; one of the Ruminantia.
Resupinate: Inverted in position; appearing to be upside down or reversed, as the flowers of the orchis and the leaves of some plants.
Romanticism: A fondness for romantic characteristics or peculiarities; specifically, in modern literature, an aiming at romantic effects; -- applied to the productions of a school of writers who sought to revive certain medi&unr_;val forms and methods in opposition to the so-called classical style.
Reprisal: The act of taking from an enemy by way of reteliation or indemnity.
&Verbar;Remanet: A case for trial which can not be tried during the term; a postponed case.
&Verbar;Resum\u00e9: A summing up; a condensed statement; an abridgment or brief recapitulation.
Rebuke: A direct and pointed reproof; a reprimand; also, chastisement; punishment.
Recurvation: The act of recurving, or the state of being recurved; a bending or flexure backward.
&Verbar;Reticularia: An extensive division of rhizopods in which the pseudopodia are more or less slender and coalesce at certain points, forming irregular meshes. It includes the shelled Foraminifera, together with some groups which lack a true shell.
Riderless: Having no rider; as, a riderless horse.
Retirement: The act of retiring, or the state of being retired; withdrawal; seclusion; as, the retirement of an officer.
Red-tapist: One who is tenacious of a strict adherence to official formalities.
Retrace: To trace back, as a line.
Reservist: A member of a reserve force of soldiers or militia.
Readjourn: To adjourn a second time; to adjourn again.
Reprobationer: One who believes in reprobation. See Reprobation, 2.
Rheotrope: An instrument for reversing the direction of an electric current.
Retract: The pricking of a horse's foot in nailing on a shoe.
Reorganization: The act of reorganizing; a reorganized existence; as, reorganization of the troops.
Rabble-rout: A tumultuous crowd; a rabble; a noisy throng.
Ropeband: A small piece of spun yarn or marline, used to fasten the head of the sail to the spar.
&Verbar;Rhynchonella: A genus of brachiopods of which some species are still living, while many are found fossil.
Reinsurance: Insurance a second time or again; renewed insurance.
Rochelime: Lime in the lump after it is burned; quicklime.
Ruffian: To play the ruffian; to rage; to raise tumult.
Relegation: The act of relegating, or the state of being relegated; removal; banishment; exile.
Readmit: To admit again; to give entrance or access to again.
Reciprocal: That which is reciprocal to another thing.
ride the lightning: to be executed by electrocution in the electric chair.
Roche alum: A kind of alum occuring in small fragments; -- so called from Rocca, in Syria, whence alum is said to have been obtained; -- also called rock alum.
Radiantly: In a radiant manner; with glittering splendor.
Rawhead: A specter mentioned to frighten children; as, rawhead and bloodybones.
Rennet: The inner, or mucous, membrane of the fourth stomach of the calf, or other young ruminant.
Rebaptize: To baptize again or a second time.
Riot: To spend or pass in riot.
Rectiserial: Arranged in exactly vertical ranks, as the leaves on stems of many kinds; -- opposed to curviserial.
Raguled: Notched in regular diagonal breaks; -- said of a line, or a bearing having such an edge.
Reconsolidation: The act or process of reconsolidating; the state of being reconsolidated.
Rowable: That may be rowed, or rowed upon.
Remissibility: The state or quality of being remissible.
Radiotelegraphic: Of or pertaining to radiotelegraphy; employing, or used or employed in, radiotelegraphy.
Reasonless: Destitute of reason; as, a reasonless man or mind.
Ruttier: A chart of a course, esp. at sea.
Regelation: The act or process of freezing anew, or together,as two pieces of ice.
Redingote: A long plain double-breasted outside coat for women.
Right-angled: Containing a right angle or right angles; as, a right-angled triangle.
Rusticated: Resembling rustic work. See Rustic work (a), under Rustic.
Rhombohedron: A solid contained by six rhomboids; a parallelopiped.
Rhomboidal: Having, or approaching, the shape of a rhomboid.
Reciprocate: To give and return mutually; to make return for; to give in return; to interchange; to alternate; as, to reciprocate favors.
Ramberge: Formerly, a kind of large war galley.
Racemiform: Having the form of a raceme.
&Verbar;Rondeletia: A tropical genus of rubiaceous shrubs which often have brilliant flowers.
Ridgepole: The timber forming the ridge of a roof, into which the rafters are secured.
Roster: A register or roll showing the order in which officers, enlisted men, companies, or regiments are called on to serve.
Reascend: To ascend or mount again; to reach by ascending again.
Ra-: A prefix, from the Latin re and ad combined, coming to us through the French and Italian. See Re-, and Ad-.
Raiment: Clothing in general; vesture; garments; -- usually singular in form, with a collective sense.
Rh\u00e6tizite: A variety of the mineral cyanite.
Rousant: Rising; -- applied to a bird in the attitude of rising; also, sometmes, to a bird in profile with wings addorsed.
Rosiny: like rosin, or having its qualities.
Reascent: A returning ascent or ascension; acclivity.
Requisite: Required by the nature of things, or by circumstances; so needful that it can not be dispensed with; necessary; indispensable.
Risky: Attended with risk or danger; hazardous.
Regurgitation: The act of flowing or pouring back by the orifice of entrance
Reaction: Any action in resisting other action or force; counter tendency; movement in a contrary direction; reverse action.
Resolve: The act of resolving or making clear; resolution; solution.
&Verbar;Remblai: Earth or materials made into a bank after having been excavated.
Radication: The process of taking root, or state of being rooted; as, the radication of habits.
Realistic: Of or pertaining to the realists; in the manner of the realists; characterized by realism rather than by imagination.
Rural: Of or pertaining to the country, as distinguished from a city or town; living in the country; suitable for, or resembling, the country; rustic; as, rural scenes; a rural prospect.
Redigest: To digest, or reduce to form, a second time.
Rissoid: Any one of very numerous species of small spiral gastropods of the genus Rissoa, or family Rissoidæ, found both in fresh and salt water.
