Relay governor: A speed regulator, as a water-wheel governor, embodying the relay principle.
Reseda: A genus of plants, the type of which is mignonette.
Re-form: To give a new form to; to form anew; to take form again, or to take a new form; as, to re-form the line after a charge.
Rag: To play or compose (a piece, melody, etc.) in syncopated time.
Rad: imp. & p. p. of Read, Rede.
Rab: A rod or stick used by masons in mixing hair with mortar.
&Verbar;Rhamphotheca: The horny covering of the bill of birds.
Ran: Yarns coiled on a spun-yarn winch.
Ram: To butt or strike against; to drive a ram against or through; to thrust or drive with violence; to force in; to drive together; to cram; as, to ram an enemy's vessel; to ram piles, cartridges, etc.
Reciprocally: In a reciprocal manner; so that each affects the other, and is equally affected by it; interchangeably; mutually.
Revolutionism: The state of being in revolution; revolutionary doctrines or principles.
Recruitment: The act or process of recruiting; especially, the enlistment of men for an army.
Rat: In English politics, to desert one's party from interested motives; to forsake one's associates for one's own advantage; in the trades, to work for less wages, or on other conditions, than those established by a trades union.
Ray grass: A perennial European grass (Lolium perenne); -- called also rye grass, and red darnel. See Darnel, and Grass.
Ray: Any one of numerous elasmobranch fishes of the order Raiæ, including the skates, torpedoes, sawfishes, etc.
Rhapsodist: Anciently, one who recited or composed a rhapsody; especially, one whose profession was to recite the verses of Hormer and other epic poets.
Rhabdom: One of numerous minute rodlike structures formed of two or more cells situated behind the retinulæ in the compound eyes of insects, etc. See Illust. under Ommatidium.
Relegate: To remove, usually to an inferior position; to consign; to transfer; specifically, to send into exile; to banish.
Retailer: One who retails anything; as, a retailer of merchandise; a retailer of gossip; -- used also of businesses, including large corporations; as, Sears, Roebuck is one the the country's largest retailers.
Reptilian: One of the Reptilia; a reptile.
Reluctance: The state or quality of being reluctant; repugnance; aversion of mind; unwillingness; -- often followed by an infinitive, or by to and a noun, formerly sometimes by against.
Rebate: To cut a rebate in. See Rabbet, v.
Revengeful: Full of, or prone to, revenge; vindictive; malicious; revenging; wreaking revenge.
Referential: Containing a reference; pointing to something out of itself; as, notes for referential use.
Raglan: A loose overcoat with large sleeves; -- named after Lord Raglan, an English general who was an aide-de-camp to Wellington at Waterlooo.
Rhea: Any one of three species of large South American ostrichlike birds of the genera Rhea and Pterocnemia. Called also the American ostrich.
Reading: Of or pertaining to the act of reading; used in reading.
Retexture: The act of weaving or forming again.
Renewability: The quality or state of being renewable.
Rhombohedral: Related to the rhombohedron; presenting the form of a rhombohedron, or a form derivable from a rhombohedron; relating to a system of forms including the rhombohedron and scalenohedron.
Rimer: A tool for shaping the rimes of a ladder.
Round-arm: Applied to the method delivering the ball in bowling, by swinging the arm horizontally.
research: To search or examine with continued care; to seek diligently.
Radicle: The rudimentary stem of a plant which supports the cotyledons in the seed, and from which the root is developed downward; the stem of the embryo; the caulicle.
R&D: research and development; used mostly to refer to the division of a corporation responsible for performing research and developing new products; -- a commonly used abbreviation.
Railroad: To carry or send by railroad; usually fig., to send or put through at high speed or in great haste; to hurry or rush unduly; as, to railroad a bill through Condress.
Ride: The act of riding; an excursion on horseback or in a vehicle.
Repayable: Capable of being, or proper to be, repaid; due; as, a loan repayable in ten days; services repayable in kind.
Revolvency: The act or state of revolving; revolution.
Respondence: The act of responding; the state of being respondent; an answering.
Roseroot: A fleshy-leaved herb (Rhodiola rosea); rosewort; -- so called because the roots have the odor of roses.
Receive: To receive visitors; to be at home to receive calls; as, she receives on Tuesdays.
Rackwork: Any mechanism having a rack, as a rack and pinion.
Roughhewn: Hewn coarsely without smoothing; unfinished; not polished.
Reception: The act of receiving; receipt; admission; as, the reception of food into the stomach; the reception of a letter; the reception of sensation or ideas; reception of evidence.
Retrogradation: The act of retrograding, or moving backward.
Ricinoleate: A salt of ricinoleic acid; -- formerly called palmate.
Remonetize: To restore to use as money; as, to remonetize silver.
Recomforture: The act of recomforting; restoration of comfort.
&Verbar;Regius: Of or pertaining to a king; royal.
&Verbar;Ranula: A cyst formed under the tongue by obstruction of the duct of the submaxillary gland.
Recapper: A tool used for applying a fresh percussion cap or primer to a cartridge shell in reloading it.
Resistance frame: A rheostat consisting of an open frame on which are stretched spirals of wire. Being freely exposed to the air, they radiate heat rapidly.
Reassert: To assert again or anew; to maintain after an omission to do so.
Rubicundity: The quality or state of being rubicund; ruddiness.
Refusable: Capable of being refused; admitting of refusal.
Redroot: A name of several plants having red roots, as the New Jersey tea (see under Tea), the gromwell, the bloodroot, and the Lachnanthes tinctoria, an endogenous plant found in sandy swamps from Rhode Island to Florida.
&Verbar;Ressaldar: In the Anglo-Indian army, a native commander of a ressala.
Ravenous: Devouring with rapacious eagerness; furiously voracious; hungry even to rage; as, a ravenous wolf or vulture.
Retentive: That which retains or confines; a restraint.
Rubblework: Masonry constructed of unsquared stones that are irregular in size and shape.
Rambler: One who rambles; a rover; a wanderer.
Rationalist: One who accepts rationalism as a theory or system; also, disparagingly, a false reasoner. See Citation under Reasonist.
Referendary: One to whose decision a cause is referred; a referee.
Roostcock: The male of the domestic fowl; a cock.
&Verbar;Reis: The word is used as a Portuguese designation of money of account, one hundred reis being about equal in value to eleven cents.
&Verbar;Rincon: An interior corner; a nook; hence, an angular recess or hollow bend in a mountain, river, cliff, or the like.
Relaxant: A medicine that relaxes; a laxative.
&Verbar;Rhynchocephala: An order of reptiles having biconcave vertebræ, immovable quadrate bones, and many other peculiar osteological characters. Hatteria is the only living genus, but numerous fossil genera are known, some of which are among the earliest of reptiles. See Hatteria. Called also Rhynchocephalia.
Rufol: A phenol derivative of anthracene obtained as a white crystalline substance, which on oxidation produces a red dyestuff related to anthraquinone.
Reverend: Worthy of reverence; entitled to respect mingled with fear and affection; venerable.
Roundridge: To form into round ridges by plowing.
Revertive: Reverting, or tending to revert; returning.
Ratiocinative: Characterized by, or addicted to, ratiocination; consisting in the comparison of propositions or facts, and the deduction of inferences from the comparison; argumentative; as, a ratiocinative process.
Resonance: The act of resounding; the quality or state of being resonant.
Rationalism: The doctrine or system of those who deduce their religious opinions from reason or the understanding, as distinct from, or opposed to, revelation.
Revertible: Capable of, or admitting of, reverting or being reverted; as, a revertible estate.
Reminder: One who, or that which, reminds; that which serves to awaken remembrance.
Reposal: The act or state of reposing; as, the reposal of a trust.
Rolling-pin: A cylindrical piece of wood or other material, with which paste or dough may be rolled out and reduced to a proper thickness.
Revetment: A facing of wood, stone, or any other material, to sustain an embankment when it receives a slope steeper than the natural slope; also, a retaining wall.
Repand: Having a slightly undulating margin; -- said of leaves.
Retributive: Of or pertaining to retribution; of the nature of retribution; involving retribution or repayment; as, retributive justice; retributory comforts.
Redemptioner: One who redeems himself, as from debt or servitude.
Ralstonite: A fluoride of alumina and soda occurring with the Greenland cryolite in octahedral crystals.
Reconvene: To convene or assemble again; to call or come together again.
Readmittance: Allowance to enter again; a second admission.
Rehabilitate: To invest or clothe again with some right, authority, or dignity; to restore to a former capacity; to reinstate; to qualify again; to restore, as a delinquent, to a former right, rank, or privilege lost or forfeited; -- a term of civil and canon law.
Ritualism: A system founded upon a ritual or prescribed form of religious worship; adherence to, or observance of, a ritual.
Rompu: Broken, as an ordinary; cut off, or broken at the top, as a chevron, a bend, or the like.
Rattler: One who, or that which, rattles.
Rollic: To move or play in a careless, swaggering manner, with a frolicsome air; to frolic; to sport; commonly in the form rollicking.
Republish: To publish anew; specifically, to publish in one country (a work first published in another); also, to revive (a will) by re&unr_;xecution or codicil.
Russophile: One who, not being a Russian, favors Russian policy and aggrandizement.
Residual: The difference of the results obtained by observation, and by computation from a formula.
Rancid: Having a rank smell or taste, from chemical change or decomposition; musty; as, rancid oil or butter.
Roundish: Somewhat round; as, a roundish seed; a roundish figure.
Retainer: One who, or that which, retains.
Radiophare: A radiotelegraphic station serving solely for determining the position of ships. The radius of operation of such stations was restricted by the International Radiotelegraphic Convention (1912) to 30 nautical miles.
Ratchet: A pawl, click, or detent, for holding or propelling a ratchet wheel, or ratch, etc.
Roam: The act of roaming; a wandering; a ramble; as, he began his roam o'er hill and dale.
&Verbar;Rixdaler: A Dutch silver coin, worth about $1.00.
Road: A journey, or stage of a journey.
Rowport: An opening in the side of small vessels of war, near the surface of the water, to facilitate rowing in calm weather.
&Verbar;Rheumides: The class of skin disease developed by the dartrous diathesis. See under Dartrous.
Radish: The pungent fleshy root of a well-known cruciferous plant (Raphanus sativus); also, the whole plant.
Regeneration: The act of regenerating, or the state of being regenerated.
Recidivist: One who is recidivous or is characterized by recidivism; an incorrigible criminal.
&Verbar;Ranchero: A herdsman; a peasant employed on a ranch or rancho.
Recrudescent: Growing raw, sore, or painful again.
Rhumb: A line which crosses successive meridians at a constant angle; -- called also rhumb line, and loxodromic curve. See Loxodromic.
Revelation: The act of revealing, disclosing, or discovering to others what was before unknown to them.
Refrangible: Capable of being refracted, or turned out of a direct course, in passing from one medium to another, as rays of light.
Rorulent: Full of, or abounding in, dew.
Rhythm: In the widest sense, a dividing into short portions by a regular succession of motions, impulses, sounds, accents, etc., producing an agreeable effect, as in music poetry, the dance, or the like.
Rose-water: Having the odor of rose water; hence, affectedly nice or delicate; sentimental.
Rowel: To insert a rowel, or roll of hair or silk, into (as the flesh of a horse).
Repudiable: Admitting of repudiation; fit or proper to be put away.
Renovator: One who, or that which, renovates.
Rider: One who, or that which, rides.
Rehearsal: The act of rehearsing; recital; narration; repetition; specifically, a private recital, performance, or season of practice, in preparation for a public exhibition or exercise.
Remissful: Inclined to remit punishment; lenient; clement.
Rheomotor: Any apparatus by which an electrical current is originated.
Repeller: One who, or that which, repels.
Rugosity: The quality or state of being rugose.
Recrementitious: Of or pertaining to recrement; consisting of recrement or dross.
Roaring: A loud, deep, prolonged sound, as of a large beast, or of a person in distress, anger, mirth, etc., or of a noisy congregation.
Retraction: The act of retracting, or drawing back; the state of being retracted; as, the retraction of a cat's claws.
Reinterrogate: To interrogate again; to question repeatedly.
Rent: To be leased, or let for rent; as, an estate rents for five hundred dollars a year.
Randan: A boat propelled by three rowers with four oars, the middle rower pulling two.
Reciter: One who recites; also, a book of extracts for recitation.
Routinist: One who habituated to a routine.
Rump: The end of the backbone of an animal, with the parts adjacent; the buttock or buttocks.
Remit: To abate in force or in violence; to grow less intense; to become moderated; to abate; to relax; as, a fever remits; the severity of the weather remits.
Referable: Capable of being referred, or considered in relation to something else; assignable; ascribable.
Raucity: Harshness of sound; rough utterance; hoarseness; as, the raucity of a trumpet, or of the human voice.
Ripidolite: A translucent mineral of a green color and micaceous structure, belonging to the chlorite group; a hydrous silicate of alumina, magnesia, and iron; -- called also clinochlore.
Redshank: A common Old World limicoline bird (Totanus calidris), having the legs and feet pale red. The spotted redshank (Totanus fuscus) is larger, and has orange-red legs. Called also redshanks, redleg, and clee.
Rosaniline: A complex nitrogenous base, C20H21N3O, obtained by oxidizing a mixture of aniline and toluidine, as a colorless crystalline substance which forms red salts. These salts are essential components of many of the socalled aniline dyes, as fuchsine, aniline red, etc. By extension, any one of the series of substances derived from, or related to, rosaniline proper.
Reconcilable: Capable of being reconciled; as, reconcilable adversaries; an act reconciable with previous acts.
Reaggravation: The last monitory, published after three admonitions and before the last excommunication.
Represent: To present again or anew; to present by means of something standing in the place of; to exhibit the counterpart or image of; to typify.
Rosulate: Arranged in little roselike clusters; -- said of leaves and bracts.
Ranterism: The practice or tenets of the Ranters.
Russify: To Russianize; as, to Russify conquered tribes.
Reefer: One who reefs; -- a name often given to midshipmen.
Radiotherapy: Treatment of disease by means of x-rays or radioactivity.  Radiotherapy of cancer is based on the fact that cancer cells are more sensitive to radiation than most other cells in the body.
Reciprocation: The act of reciprocating; interchange of acts; a mutual giving and returning; as, the reciprocation of kindness.
Roan: The color of a roan horse; a roan color.
Rheophore: A connecting wire of an electric or voltaic apparatus, traversed by a current.
Redhoop: The male of the European bullfinch.
Ratio: The relation which one quantity or magnitude has to another of the same kind. It is expressed by the quotient of the division of the first by the second; thus, the ratio of 3 to 6 is expressed by 3/6 or 1/2; of a to b by a/b; or (less commonly) the second term is made the dividend; as, a:b = b/a.
Rosefish: A large marine scorpænoid food fish (Sebastes marinus) found on the northern coasts of Europe and America. called also red perch, hemdurgan, Norway haddok, and also, erroneously, snapper, bream, and bergylt.
Royalism: the principles or conduct of royalists.
Rarefaction: The act or process of rarefying; the state of being rarefied; -- opposed to condensation; as, the rarefaction of air.
Rutylene: A liquid hydrocarbon, C10H18, of the acetylene series.  It is produced artificially.
Royalist: An adherent of a king (as of Charles I. in England, or of the Bourbons in france); one attached to monarchical government.
Recorder: One who records; specifically, a person whose official duty it is to make a record of writings or transactions.
Rug-gowned: Wearing a coarse gown or shaggy garment made of rug.
Reck: To make account; to take heed; to care; to mind; -- often followed by of.
Reimportation: The act of reimporting; also, that which is reimported.
Raree-show: A show carried about in a box; a peep show.
Rascally: Like a rascal; trickish or dishonest; base; worthless; -- often in humorous disparagement, without implication of dishonesty.
Rhomboid-ovate: Between rhomboid and ovate, or oval, in shape.
Roust: A strong tide or current, especially in a narrow channel.
Retinoid: Resinlike, or resinform; resembling a resin without being such.
Realness: The quality or condition of being real; reality.
Redolence: The quality of being redolent; sweetness of scent; pleasant odor; fragrance.
Roughleg: Any one of several species of large hawks of the genus Archibuteo, having the legs feathered to the toes.  Called also rough-legged hawk, and rough-legged buzzard.
Realize: To convert any kind of property into money, especially property representing investments, as shares in stock companies, bonds, etc.
Roching cask: A tank in which alum is crystallized from a solution.
Rolly-pooly: A game in which a ball, rolling into a certain place, wins.
Ragwort: A name given to several species of the composite genus Senecio.
Rhombogene: A dicyemid which produces infusorialike embryos; -- opposed to nematogene. See Dicyemata.
&Verbar;Rostrifera: A division of pectinibranchiate gastropods, having the head prolonged into a snout which is not retractile.
Redispose: To dispose anew or again; to readjust; to rearrange.
Ruralize: To become rural; to go into the country; to rusticate.
Rustful: Full of rust; resembling rust; causing rust; rusty.
Reclaimant: One who reclaims; one who cries out against or contradicts.
Rectificator: That which rectifies or refines; esp., a part of a distilling apparatus in which the more volatile portions are separated from the less volatile by the process of evaporation and condensation; a rectifier.
Responsibility: The state of being responsible, accountable, or answerable, as for a trust, debt, or obligation.
Ringdove: A European wild pigeon (Columba palumbus) having a white crescent on each side of the neck, whence the name. Called also wood pigeon, and cushat.
Rhodizonic: Pertaining to, or designating, a colorless crystalline substance (called rhodizonic acid, and carboxylic acid) obtained from potassium carboxide and from certain quinones. It forms brilliant red, yellow, and purple salts.
Retentivity: The power of retaining; retentive force; as, the retentivity of a magnet.
Ragwork: A kind of rubblework. In the United States, any rubblework of thin and small stones.
Recommitment: A second or renewed commitment; a renewed reference to a committee.
Randon: To go or stray at random.
Random: Going at random or by chance; done or made at hazard, or without settled direction, aim, or purpose; hazarded without previous calculation; left to chance; haphazard; as, a random guess.
Ruddle: To mark with ruddle; to raddle; to rouge.
&Verbar;Rosalia: A form of melody in which a phrase or passage is successively repeated, each time a step or half step higher; a melodic sequence.
Re\u00ebstablish: To establish anew; to fix or confirm again; to restore; as, to reëstablish a covenant; to reëstablish health.
Ribbonism: The principles and practices of the Ribbonmen.  See Ribbon Society, under Ribbon.
Rocketer: A bird, especially a pheasant, which, being flushed, rises straight in the air like a rocket.
Renard: A fox; -- so called in fables or familiar tales, and in poetry.
Rogue: To give the name or designation of rogue to; to decry.
Regredience: A going back; a retrogression; a return.
Rawness: The quality or state of being raw.
Rockfish: Any one of several California scorpænoid food fishes of the genus Sebastichthys, as the red rockfish (Sebastichthys ruber).  They are among the most important of California market fishes. Called also rock cod, and garrupa.
Repugnant: Disposed to fight against; hostile; at war with; being at variance; contrary; inconsistent; refractory; disobedient; also, distasteful in a high degree; offensive; -- usually followed by to, rarely and less properly by with; as, all rudeness was repugnant to her nature.
&Verbar;Rupicola: A genus of beautiful South American passerine birds, including the cock of the rock.
Roset: A red color used by painters.
Reformed: Corrected; amended; restored to purity or excellence; said, specifically, of the whole body of Protestant churches originating in the Reformation. Also, in a more restricted sense, of those who separated from Luther on the doctrine of consubstantiation, etc., and carried the Reformation, as they claimed, to a higher point. The Protestant churches founded by them in Switzerland, France, Holland, and part of Germany, were called the Reformed churches.
Readjuster: One who, or that which, readjusts; in some of the States of the United States, one who advocates a refunding, and sometimes a partial repudiation, of the State debt without the consent of the State's creditors.
Repass: To pass or go back; to move back; as, troops passing and repassing before our eyes.
Renascent: Springing or rising again into being; being born again, or reproduced.
Repast: To supply food to; to feast; to take food.
Rubelle: A red color used in enameling.
Rotundate: Rounded; especially, rounded at the end or ends, or at the corners.
Recapitulatory: Of the nature of a recapitulation; containing recapitulation.
Repatriate: To restore to one's own country.
Redact: To reduce to form, as literary matter; to digest and put in shape (matter for publication); to edit.
Ransomless: Incapable of being ransomed; without ransom.
Russian Church: The established church of the Russian empire up to the revolution of 1917, at which time the ruling Communist party tried to suppress all religious worship.  The czar was the nominal head of the church, but he never claimed the right of deciding questions of theology and dogma. It still forms a portion, by far the largest, of the Orthodox (Eastern) Church and is governed by the Patriarch and the Holy Synod. In 1988 the church, with official approval, celebrated the 1000 year anniversary of the baptism of Russia.  After breakup of the Soviet Union in 1991 the Russian Church began to regain some its old influence in Russian life, and the government turned over some of the confiscated churches back to church control.  The Russian Church was recognized anew as the official church of Russia, with special priveleges, by an act of the Russian Duma in 1997.  The Metropolitan of Moscow, as Patriarch of the church, is regarded as the first among equals in order of deference among bishops of the church.
&Verbar;Rotifera: An order of minute worms which usually have one or two groups of vibrating cilia on the head, which, when in motion, often give an appearance of rapidly revolving wheels.  The species are very numerous in fresh waters, and are very diversified in form and habits.
Repairer: One who, or that which, repairs, restores, or makes amends.
Raphaelite: One who advocates or adopts the principles of Raphaelism.
Receptible: Such as may be received; receivable.
Revert: One who, or that which, reverts.
Rareripe: An early ripening fruit, especially a kind of freestone peach.
Recidivism: The state or quality of being recidivous; relapse,
&Verbar;Rima: A narrow and elongated aperture; a cleft; a fissure.
&Verbar;Rouet: A small wheel formerly fixed to the pan of firelocks for discharging them.
Redundant: Exceeding what is natural or necessary; superabundant; exuberant; as, a redundant quantity of bile or food.
Repel: To act with force in opposition to force impressed; to exercise repulsion.
Reflectible: Capable of being reflected, or thrown back; reflexible.
Rumorer: A teller of news; especially, one who spreads false reports.
Radiant engine: A semiradial engine. See Radial engine, above.
&Verbar;Rafflesia: A genus of stemless, leafless plants, living parasitically upon the roots and stems of grapevines in Malaysia. The flowers have a carrionlike odor, and are very large, in one species (Rafflesia Arnoldi) having a diameter of two or three feet.
Rafting: The business of making or managing rafts.
Ring winding: Armature winding in which the wire is wound round the outer and inner surfaces alternately of an annular or cylindrical core.
Resistless: Having no power to resist; making no opposition.
Regret: To experience regret on account of; to lose or miss with a sense of regret; to feel sorrow or dissatisfaction on account of (the happening or the loss of something); as, to regret an error; to regret lost opportunities or friends.
Rudderstock: The main part or blade of the rudder, which is connected by hinges, or the like, with the sternpost of a vessel.
Racket-tailed: Having long and spatulate, or racket-shaped, tail feathers.
Rhodonite: Manganese spar, or silicate of manganese, a mineral occuring crystallised and in rose-red masses. It is often used as an ornamental stone.
Rhysimeter: An instrument, acting on the principle of Pitot's tube, for measuring the velocity of a fluid current, the speed of a ship, etc.
Repulsion: The act of repulsing or repelling, or the state of being repulsed or repelled.
Rammer: One who, or that which, rams or drives.
Regardable: Worthy of regard or notice; to be regarded; observable.
Re\u00eblect: To elect again; as, to reëlect the former governor.
Recussion: The act of beating or striking back.
Respective: Noticing with attention; hence, careful; wary; considerate.
Rerebrace: Armor for the upper part of the arm.
Rosette: An imitation of a rose by means of ribbon or other material, -- used as an ornament or a badge.
Regnancy: The condition or quality of being regnant; sovereignty; rule.
Rejudge: To judge again; to reëxamine; to review; to call to a new trial and decision.
Rhonchial: Of or pertaining to a rhonchus; produced by rhonchi.
Rattletrap: Any machine or vehicle that does not run smoothly.
Ramoon: A small West Indian tree (Trophis Americana) of the Mulberry family, whose leaves and twigs are used as fodder for cattle.
Rosland: heathy land; land full of heather; moorish or watery land.
Ranter: A noisy talker; a raving declaimer.
Rorqual: A very large North Atlantic whalebone whale (Physalus antiquorum, or Balænoptera physalus). It has a dorsal fin, and strong longitudinal folds on the throat and belly. Called also razorback.
Receiptment: The receiving or harboring a felon knowingly, after the commission of a felony.
Ring-streaked: Having circular streaks or lines on the body; as, ring-streaked goats.
Reimburse: To replace in a treasury or purse, as an equivalent for what has been taken, lost, or expended; to refund; to pay back; to restore; as, to reimburse the expenses of a war.
Rosmarine: A fabulous sea animal which was reported to climb by means of its teeth to the tops of rocks to feed upon the dew.
Rickrack: A kind of openwork edging made of serpentine braid.
Ruption: A breaking or bursting open; breach; rupture.
Refinement: The act of refining, or the state of being refined; as, the refinement or metals; refinement of ideas.
Rhadamanthus: One of the three judges of the infernal regions; figuratively, a strictly just judge.
Revolutive: Inclined to revolve things in the mind; meditative.
Rist: 3d pers. sing. pres. of Rise, contracted from riseth.
Ramed: Having the frames, stem, and sternpost adjusted; -- said of a ship on the stocks.
Ripper: One who, or that which, rips; a ripping tool.
Radial engine: An engine, usually an internal-combustion engine of a certain type (the radial type) having several cylinders arranged radially like the spokes of a complete wheel. The semiradial engine has radiating cylinders on only one side of the crank shaft.
Respirable: Suitable for being breathed; adapted for respiration.
Reverential: Proceeding from, or expressing, reverence; having a reverent quality; reverent; as, reverential fear or awe.
Recurvate: To bend or curve back; to recurve.
Recrudesce: To be in a state of recrudescence; esp., to come into renewed freshness, vigor, or activity; to revive.
Roller skate: a shoe with a set of wheels attached so that the wearer can glide over a flat surface.  To move on such a device is reverred to as to skate or to rollerskate.  To rollerskate is a form of recreation or sport.
Rompish: Given to rude play; inclined to romp; frolicsome.
Rendezvous: To bring together at a certain place; to cause to be assembled.
Raze: To erase; to efface; to obliterate.
&Verbar;Rondache: A circular shield carried by foot soldiers.
Reimprisonment: The act of reimprisoning, or the state of being reimprisoned.
Roughcast: A rude model; the rudimentary, unfinished form of a thing.
Rapid-fire mount: A mount permitting easy and quick elevation or depression and training of the gun, and fitted with a device for taking up the recoil.
Resplendent: Shining with brilliant luster; very bright.
Readjournment: The act of readjourning; a second or repeated adjournment.
Reiteration: The act of reiterating; that which is reiterated.
Reassure: To assure anew; to restore confidence to; to free from fear or terror.
Revolutionist: One engaged in effecting a change of government; a favorer of revolution.
Repose: A lying at rest; sleep; rest; quiet.
Refossion: The act of digging up again.
Reconvey: To convey back or to the former place; as, to reconvey goods.
Revelry: The act of engaging in a revel; noisy festivity; reveling.
Redde: obs. imp. of Read, or Rede.
Requirable: Capable of being required; proper to be required.
Rustler: One who, or that which, rustles.
Ramson: A broad-leaved species of garlic (Allium ursinum), common in European gardens; -- called also buckram.
Ruin: To fall to ruins; to go to ruin; to become decayed or dilapidated; to perish.
Raff: A promiscuous heap; a jumble; a large quantity; lumber; refuse.
Rust: To cause to contract rust; to corrode with rust; to affect with rust of any kind.
Ruiniform: Having the appearance of ruins, or of the ruins of houses; -- said of certain minerals.
Raft: To transport on a raft, or in the form of a raft; to make into a raft; as, to raft timber.
Riffler: A curved file used in carving wool and marble.
Recurved: Curved in an opposite or uncommon direction; bent back; as, a bird with a recurved bill; flowers with recurved petals.
Re\u00ebxchange: A renewed exchange; a reversal of an exchange.
Retection: Act of disclosing or uncovering something concealed.
&Verbar;Reptantia: A division of gastropods; the Pectinibranchiata.
Ribbing: An assemblage or arrangement of ribs, as the timberwork for the support of an arch or coved ceiling, the veins in the leaves of some plants, ridges in the fabric of cloth, or the like.
Rhinolite: A concretion formed within the cavities of the nose.
Raker: One who, or that which, rakes
Readability: The state of being readable; readableness.
Rondeau: A species of lyric poetry so composed as to contain a refrain or repetition which recurs according to a fixed law, and a limited number of rhymes recurring also by rule.
Routously: With that violation of law called a rout. See 5th Rout, 4.
Rumple: A fold or plait; a wrinkle.
Recommit: To commit again; to give back into keeping; specifically, to refer again to a committee; as, to recommit a bill to the same committee.
Rappage: The enlargement of a mold caused by rapping the pattern.
Roundsman: A patrolman; also, a policeman who acts as an inspector over the rounds of the patrolmen.
Remainder-man: One who has an estate after a particular estate is determined. See Remainder, n., 3.
Reedwork: A collective name for the reed stops of an organ.
Ring armature: An armature for a dynamo or motor having the conductors wound on a ring.
Rimbase: A short cylinder connecting a trunnion with the body of a cannon. See Illust. of Cannon.
Rancorous: Full of rancor; evincing, or caused by, rancor; deeply malignant; implacably spiteful or malicious; intensely virulent.
Radiance: The quality of being radiant; brilliancy; effulgence; vivid brightness; as, the radiance of the sun.
Rhenish: Of or pertaining to the river Rhine; as, Rhenish wine.
Randall grass: The meadow fescue (Festuca elatior). See under Grass.
Rectangular: Right-angled; having one or more angles of ninety degrees.
Ribband: A long, narrow strip of timber bent and bolted longitudinally to the ribs of a vessel, to hold them in position, and give rigidity to the framework.
Respectable: Worthy of respect; fitted to awaken esteem; deserving regard; hence, of good repute; not mean; as, a respectable citizen.
Rate: To be set or considered in a class; to have rank; as, the ship rates as a ship of the line.
Rata: A New Zealand forest tree (Metrosideros robusta), also, its hard dark red wood, used by the Maoris for paddles and war clubs.
Repletion: The state of being replete; superabundant fullness.
Racial: Of or pertaining to a race or family of men; as, the racial complexion.
Redented: Formed like the teeth of a saw; indented.
Right: To recover the proper or natural condition or position; to become upright.
&Verbar;Religieuse: A person bound by monastic vows; a nun; a monk.
Reeve: an officer, steward, bailiff, or governor; -- used chiefly in compounds; as, shirereeve, now written sheriff; portreeve, etc.
Rapacity: The quality of being rapacious; rapaciousness; ravenousness; as, the rapacity of pirates; the rapacity of wolves.
Rousing: Having power to awaken or excite; exciting.
Raciness: The quality of being racy; peculiar and piquant flavor.
Rhadamanthine: Of or pertaining to Rhadamanthus; rigorously just; as, a Rhadamanthine judgment.
Repercussion: The act of driving back, or the state of being driven back; reflection; reverberation; as, the repercussion of sound.
Remind: To put (one) in mind of something; to bring to the remembrance of; to bring to the notice or consideration of (a person).
Ripeness: The state or quality of being ripe; maturity;; completeness; perfection; as, the ripeness of grain; ripeness of manhood; ripeness of judgment.
Replicate: Folded over or backward; folded back upon itself; as, a replicate leaf or petal; a replicate margin of a shell.
Reconstruction: The act of constructing again; the state of being reconstructed.
Regratery: The act or practice of regrating.
Re-mark: To mark again, or a second time; to mark anew.
Resupination: The state of luing on the back; the state of being resupinate, or reversed.
Retrospection: The act, or the faculty, of looking back on things past.
&Verbar;Rhaphides: Minute transparent, often needle-shaped, crystals found in the tissues of plants.
Rheometry: The measurement of the force or intensity of currents.
Rabbler: A scraping tool for smoothing metal.
Rapturous: Ecstatic; transporting; ravishing; feeling, expressing, or manifesting rapture; as, rapturous joy, pleasure, or delight; rapturous applause.
Recount: To tell over; to relate in detail; to recite; to tell or narrate the particulars of; to rehearse; to enumerate; as, to recount one's blessings.
Rechabite: One of the descendants of Jonadab, the son of Rechab, all of whom by his injunction abstained from the use of intoxicating drinks and even from planting the vine. Jer. xxxv. 2-19. Also, in modern times, a member of a certain society of abstainers from alcoholic liquors.
&Verbar;Redia: A kind of larva, or nurse, which is prroduced within the sporocyst of certain trematodes by asexual generation. It in turn produces, in the same way, either another generation of rediæ, or else cercariæ within its own body. Called also proscolex, and nurse. See Illustration in Appendix.
Rebeldom: A region infested by rebels; rebels, considered collectively; also, conduct or quality characteristic of rebels.
Rabot: A rubber of hard wood used in smoothing marble to be polished.
Rimmer: An implement for cutting, trimming, or ornamenting the rim of anything, as the edges of pies, etc.; also, a reamer.
Rodsman: One who carries and holds a leveling staff, or rod, in a surveying party.
Redound: The coming back, as of consequence or effect; result; return; requital.
Revisional: Of or pertaining to revision; revisory.
Rustiness: The quality or state of being rusty.
Ruttle: A rattling sound in the throat arising from difficulty of breathing; a rattle.
Religiosity: The quality of being religious; religious feeling or sentiment; religiousness.
Ribwort: A species of plantain (Plantago lanceolata) with long, narrow, ribbed leaves; -- called also rib grass, ripple grass, ribwort plantain.
R and D: research and development; -- used mostly to refer to the division of a corporation responsible for performing research and developing new products; -- a commonly used abbreviation.
&Verbar;Racahout: A preparation from acorns used by the Arabs as a substitute for chocolate, and also as a beverage for invalids.
Reflector: One who, or that which, reflects.
Rondel: A small round tower erected at the foot of a bastion.
Roric: Of or pertaining to dew; resembling dew; dewy.
Rejuvenated: Rendered young again; as, rejuvenated life.
Rhyparography: In ancient art, the painting of genre or still-life pictures.
&Verbar;Relais: A narrow space between the foot of the rampart and the scarp of the ditch, serving to receive the earth that may crumble off or be washed down, and prevent its falling into the ditch.
Reedy: Abounding with reeds; covered with reeds.
Rebellow: To bellow again; to repeat or echo a bellow.
&Verbar;Rana: A genus of anurous batrachians, including the common frogs.
Recoup: To keep back rightfully (a part), as if by cutting off, so as to diminish a sum due; to take off (a part) from damages; to deduct; as, where a landlord recouped the rent of premises from damages awarded to the plaintiff for eviction.
&Verbar;Rani: A queen or princess; the wife of a rajah.
Refar: To go over again; to repeat.
Rhubarb: The name of several large perennial herbs of the genus Rheum and order Polygonaceæ.
&Verbar;Rachitis: Literally, inflammation of the spine, but commonly applied to the rickets. See Rickets.
Reverter: One who, or that which, reverts.
Rhapsodic: Of or pertaining to rhapsody; consisting of rhapsody; hence, confused; unconnected.
Recreation: The act of recreating, or the state of being recreated; refreshment of the strength and spirits after toil; amusement; diversion; sport; pastime.
Rolling: Rotating on an axis, or moving along a surface by rotation; turning over and over as if on an axis or a pivot; as, a rolling wheel or ball.
Ring-tailed: Having the tail crossed by conspicuous bands of color.
Requisitor: One who makes reqisition; esp., one authorized by a requisition to investigate facts.
Regimental: Belonging to, or concerning, a regiment; as, regimental officers, clothing.
Retrogression: The act of retrograding, or going backward; retrogradation.
Rosedrop: A lozenge having a rose flavor.
Rejection: Act of rejecting, or state of being rejected.
Ratite: Of or pertaining to the Ratitæ.
Reflecting: Throwing back light, heat, etc., as a mirror or other surface.
Reconquer: To conquer again; to recover by conquest; as, to reconquer a revolted province.
Rejoint: To reunite the joints of; to joint anew.
Retinol: A hydrocarbon oil C32H16, obtained by the distillation of resin, -- used as a solvent, as an antiseptic, and in printer's ink.
Ratepayer: One who pays rates or taxes.
Rowdy: One who engages in rows, or noisy quarrels; a ruffianly fellow.
Re\u00ebdify: To edify anew; to build again after destruction.
Runt: Any animal which is unusually small, as compared with others of its kind; -- applied particularly to domestic animals.
Raccoon: A North American nocturnal carnivore (Procyon lotor) allied to the bears, but much smaller, and having a long, full tail, banded with black and gray. Its body is gray, varied with black and white. Called also coon, and mapach.
Remover: One who removes; as, a remover of landmarks.
Russia: A country of Europe and Asia.
Respectability: The state or quality of being respectable; the state or quality which deserves or commands respect.
Recto-uterine: Of or pertaining to both the rectum and the uterus.
Roundheaded: Having a round head or top.
Rhythmometer: An instrument for marking time in musical movements. See Metronome.
Routinism: the practice of doing things with undiscriminating, mechanical regularity.
Rob: To take that which belongs to another, without right or permission, esp. by violence.
Roc: A monstrous bird of Arabian mythology.
Roe: The ova or spawn of fishes and amphibians, especially when still inclosed in the ovarian membranes. Sometimes applied, loosely, to the sperm and the testes of the male.
Reeding: A small convex molding; a reed (see Illust. (i) of Molding); one of several set close together to decorate a surface; also, decoration by means of reedings; -- the reverse of fluting.
Resumption: The act of resuming; as, the resumption of a grant, of delegated powers, of an argument, of specie payments, etc.
Resolvable: Admitting of being resolved; admitting separation into constituent parts, or reduction to first principles; admitting solution or explanation; as, resolvable compounds; resolvable ideas or difficulties.
Repopulation: The act of repeopling; act of furnishing with a population anew.
Recalcitrant: Kicking back; recalcitrating; hence, showing repugnance or opposition; refractory.
Respectively: As relating to each; particularly; as each belongs to each; as each refers to each in order; as, let each man respectively perform his duty.
Relive: To recall to life; to revive.
Roundabout: A large horizontal wheel or frame, commonly with wooden horses, etc., on which children ride; a merry-go-round; a carousel.
Rigel: A fixed star of the first magnitude in the left foot of the constellation Orion.
Rascal: Of or pertaining to the common herd or common people; low; mean; base.
Relatedness: The state or condition of being related; relationship; affinity.
Relativistic mass equation:
an equation expressing the mass of an object as a function of its velocity: as the velocity v of an object increases, its mass m increases from its rest mass m0 according to the equation:
   m = m0/1 - v2/c2

where c is the speed of light in a vacuum.  If the speed of an object were to become equal to that of light, it can be seen that the mass would be infinite, from which it follows that nothing can accelerate up to or beyond the speed of light.
Rebullition: The act of boiling up or effervescing.
Recidivous: Tending or liable to backslide or relapse to a former condition or habit.
Rufigallic: Pertaining to, or designating, an acid which is obtained from gallic acid as a brown or red crystalline substance, and is related to rufiopin and anthracene.
Ruth: Sorrow for the misery of another; pity; tenderness.
Redden: To grow or become red; to blush.
resilience: The act of springing back, rebounding, or resiling; as, the resilience of a ball or of sound.
Riddling: Speaking in a riddle or riddles; containing a riddle.
&Verbar;Retentor: A muscle which serves to retain an organ or part in place, esp. when retracted. See Illust. of Phylactolemata.
Rhizomatous: Having the nature or habit of a rhizome or rootstock.
&Verbar;Rongeur: An instrument for removing small rough portions of bone.
Repaganize: To paganize anew; to bring back to paganism.
Ragout: A dish made of pieces of meat, stewed, and highly seasoned; as, a ragout of mutton.
Rocambole: A name of Allium Scorodoprasum and Allium Ascalonium, two kinds of garlic, the latter of which is also called shallot.
Ribible: A small threestringed viol; a rebec.
Respiratory: Of or pertaining to respiration; serving for respiration; as, the respiratory organs; respiratory nerves; the respiratory function; respiratory changes.
Re\u00ebstablishment: The act reëstablishing; the state of being reëstablished.
Reflexibility: The quality or capability of being reflexible; as, the reflexibility of the rays of light.
Ritualist: One skilled un, or attached to, a ritual; one who advocates or practices ritualism.
&Verbar;Reconcentrado: Lit., one who has been reconcentrated; specif., in Cuba, the Philippines, etc., during the revolution of 1895-98, one of the rural noncombatants who were concentrated by the military authorities in areas surrounding the fortified towns, and later were reconcentrated in the smaller limits of the towns themselves.
Regnant: Exercising regal authority; reigning; as, a queen regnant.
Ratification: The act of ratifying; the state of being ratified; confirmation; sanction; as, the ratification of a treaty.
Roughness: The quality or state of being rough.
Resolution: The act, operation, or process of resolving.
&Verbar;Rixatrix: A scolding or quarrelsome woman; a scold.
&Verbar;Restaurateur: The keeper of an eathing house or a restaurant.
Reglet: A flat, narrow molding, used chiefly to separate the parts or members of compartments or panels from one another, or doubled, turned, and interlaced so as to form knots, frets, or other ornaments. See Illust. (12) of Column.
Runaround: a delaying or evasive, and sometimes deceptive, answer to an inquiry or request.
Rowlock: A contrivance or arrangement serving as a fulcrum for an oar in rowing. It consists sometimes of a notch in the gunwale of a boat, sometimes of a pair of pins between which the oar rests on the edge of the gunwale, sometimes of a single pin passing through the oar, or of a metal fork or stirrup pivoted in the gunwale and suporting the oar; same as oarlock.
Rocking-horse: The figure of a horse, mounted upon rockers, for children to ride.
Rattle: A rapid succession of sharp, clattering sounds; as, the rattle of a drum.
Redress: The act of redressing; a making right; reformation; correction; amendment.
&Verbar;Retitel\u00e6: A group of spiders which spin irregular webs; -- called also Retitelariæ.
Reparel: A change of apparel; a second or different suit.
Rashness: The quality or state of being rash.
Reeky: Soiled with smoke or steam; smoky; foul.
Red-hot: Red with heat; heated to redness; as, red-hot iron; red-hot balls. Hence, figuratively, excited; violent; as, a red-hot radical.
Rat-tailed: Having a long, tapering tail like that of a rat.
Recurrence: The act of recurring, or state of being recurrent; return; resort; recourse.
Ramline: A line used to get a straight middle line, as on a spar, or from stem to stern in building a vessel.
River: To hawk by the side of a river; to fly hawks at river fowl.
Rockwork: Stonework in which the surface is left broken and rough.
Rifleman: A soldier armed with a rifle.
Rhetorical: Of or pertaining to rhetoric; according to, or exhibiting, rhetoric; oratorical; as, the rhetorical art; a rhetorical treatise; a rhetorical flourish.
Racemation: A cluster or bunch, as of grapes.
Ruelle: A private circle or assembly at a private house; a circle.
Roundtop: A top; a platform at a masthead; -- so called because formerly round in shape.
Recline: Having a reclining posture; leaning; reclining.
Retrochoir: Any extension of a church behind the high altar, as a chapel; also, in an apsidal church, all the space beyond the line of the back or eastern face of the altar.
Rubberize: To coat or impregnate with rubber or a rubber solution or preparation, as silk.
Reputable: Having, or worthy of, good repute; held in esteem; honorable; praiseworthy; as, a reputable man or character; reputable conduct.
Royal spade: A spade when spades are trumps under the condition that every trick over six taken by the successful bidder has a score value of 9; -- usually in pl.
Rimey: To compose in rhyme; to versify.
Rumorous: Of or pertaining to a rumor; of the nature of rumors.
Rockweed: Any coarse seaweed growing on sea-washed rocks, especially Fucus.
Riser: One who rises; as, an early riser.
Reinstatement: The act of reinstating; the state of being reinstated; re&unr_;stablishment.
Rebuff: To beat back; to offer sudden resistance to; to check; to repel or repulse violently, harshly, or uncourteously.
Reanimation: The act or operation of reanimating, or the state of being reanimated; reinvigoration; revival.
Remediable: Capable of being remedied or cured.
Repulser: One who repulses, or drives back.
Recumbent: Leaning; reclining; lying; as, the recumbent posture of the Romans at their meals. Hence, figuratively; Resting; inactive; idle.
Ruthenic: Pertaining to, or containing, ruthenium; specifically, designating those compounds in which it has a higher valence as contrasted with ruthenious compounds.
Recollect: A friar of the Strict Observance, -- an order of Franciscans.
Retable: A shelf behind the altar, for display of lights, vases of flowers, etc.
Reassign: To assign back or again; to transfer back what has been assigned.
Retreatment: The act of retreating; specifically, the Hegira.
Ringhead: An instrument used for stretching woolen cloth.
Rogueship: The quality or state of being a rogue.
Rowdyish: Resembling a rowdy in temper or conduct; characteristic of a rowdy.
Rechase: To chase again; to chase or drive back.
Ropewalk: A long, covered walk, or a low, level building, where ropes are manufactured.
Responsal: One who is answerable or responsible.
&Verbar;Roux: A thickening, made of flour, for soups and gravies.
Reversion: The act of returning, or coming back; return.
&Verbar;R\u00e9pertoire: A list of dramas, operas, pieces, parts, etc., which a company or a person has rehearsed and is prepared to perform.
Rooty: Full of roots; as, rooty ground.
Revirescence: A growing green or fresh again; renewal of youth or vigor.
Roomy: Having ample room; spacious; large; as, a roomy mansion; a roomy deck.
Require: To demand; to insist upon having; to claim as by right and authority; to exact; as, to require the surrender of property.
&Verbar;Rhinoscleroma: A rare disease of the skin, characterized by the development of very hard, more or less flattened, prominences, appearing first upon the nose and subsequently upon the neighboring parts, esp. the lips, palate, and throat.
Ribbon: To adorn with, or as with, ribbons; to mark with stripes resembling ribbons.
Readily: In a ready manner; quickly; promptly.
Razor: A keen-edged knife of peculiar shape, used in shaving the hair from the face or the head; also called a straight razor.
Rushiness: The quality or state of abounding with rushes.
Rivose: Marked with sinuate and irregular furrows.
Reconcentration: The act of reconcentrating or the state of being reconcentrated; esp., the act or policy of concentrating the rural population in or about towns and villages for convenience in political or military administration, as in Cuba during the revolution of 1895-98.
Ratihabition: Confirmation or approbation, as of an act or contract.
Redisburse: To disburse anew; to give, or pay, back.
&Verbar;Retraxit: The withdrawing, or open renunciation, of a suit in court by the plaintiff, by which he forever lost his right of action.
Reins: The kidneys; also, the region of the kidneys; the loins.
Righteous: Doing, or according with, that which is right; yielding to all their due; just; equitable; especially, free from wrong, guilt, or sin; holy; as, a righteous man or act; a righteous retribution.
Revision: The act of revising; reëxamination for correction; review; as, the revision of a book or writing, or of a proof sheet; a revision of statutes.
Relishable: Capable of being relished; agreeable to the taste; gratifying.
Retail: To sell in small quantities, as by the single yard, pound, gallon, etc.; to sell directly to the consumer; as, to retail cloth or groceries.
Retrocedent: Disposed or likely to retrocede; -- said of diseases which go from one part of the body to another, as the gout.
Ragtime: a rhythm with a regular accompaniment in two-four time and a melody characterized by syncopation, first recognized in many negro melodies; also a style of American music in this rhythm.
Reticence: The quality or state of being reticent, or keeping silence; the state of holding one's tonque; refraining to speak of that which is suggested; uncommunicativeness.
Registry: The act of recording or writing in a register; enrollment; registration.
Rifle: To grove; to channel; especially, to groove internally with spiral channels; as, to rifle a gun barrel or a cannon.
Rupture: To suffer a breach or disruption.
Roller coaster: An amusement railroad of varying design in which open cars coast by gravity over a long winding track in a closed circuit, with steep pitches and ascents, and in some cases loops in which the cars are briefly upside-down; typically, the cars are pulled by a chain device to the top of the first peak, after which gravity and momentum provide the only propulsive forces.  In some cases, the cars are suspended from a monorail rather than resting on a track, and such cars may be made to swing outward at an angle near to the horizontal.  It is a popular amusement at many amusement parks, but is sufficiently frightening to some people that they refuse to ride in one.
Romping: Inclined to romp; indulging in romps.
Region: One of the grand districts or quarters into which any space or surface, as of the earth or the heavens, is conceived of as divided; hence, in general, a portion of space or territory of indefinite extent; country; province; district; tract.
Radiatiform: Having the marginal florets enlarged and radiating but not ligulate, as in the capitula or heads of the cornflower.
Rizzar: To dry in the sun; as, rizzared haddock.
Refutation: The act or process of refuting or disproving, or the state of being refuted; proof of falsehood or error; the overthrowing of an argument, opinion, testimony, doctrine, or theory, by argument or countervailing proof.
Redintegration: Restoration to a whole or sound state; renewal; renovation.
Rough-legged: Having the legs covered with feathers; -- said of a bird.
&Verbar;Rhabdopleura: A genus of marine Bryozoa in which the tubular cells have a centralchitinous axis and the tentacles are borne on a bilobed lophophore. It is the type of the order Pterobranchia, or Podostomata
Rejectable: Capable of being, or that ought to be, rejected.
Ropy: capable of being drawn into a thread, as a glutinous substance; stringy; viscous; tenacious; glutinous; as ropy sirup; ropy lees.
Remarkable: Worthy of being remarked or noticed; noticeable; conspicuous; hence, uncommon; extraordinary.
Rosery: A place where roses are cultivated; a nursery of roses. See Rosary, 1.
Recipe: A formulary or prescription for making some combination, mixture, or preparation of materials; a receipt.
Richweed: An herb (Pilea pumila) of the Nettle family, having a smooth, juicy, pellucid stem; -- called also clearweed.
Raphaelesque: Like Raphael's works; in Raphael's manner of painting.
Rudmasday: Either of the feasts of the Holy Cross, occuring on May 3 and September 14, annually.
Reapplication: The act of reapplying, or the state of being reapplied.
Reword: To repeat in the same words; to reëcho.
Rack-rent: To subject to rack-rent, as a farm or tenant.
Remean: To give meaning to; to explain the meaning of; to interpret.
Rock staff: An oscillating bar in a machine, as the lever of the bellows of a forge.
Reverberative: Of the nature of reverberation; tending to reverberate; reflective.
Remittor: One who makes a remittance; a remitter.
Radiation: The act of radiating, or the state of being radiated; emission and diffusion of rays of light; beamy brightness.
Resultance: The act of resulting; that which results; a result.
Ravage: To lay waste by force; to desolate by violence; to commit havoc or devastation upon; to spoil; to plunder; to consume.
Ridgy: Having a ridge or ridges; rising in a ridge.
Rowed: Formed into a row, or rows; having a row, or rows; as, a twelve-rowed ear of corn.
Runner: One who, or that which, runs; a racer.
Rapturize: To put, or be put, in a state of rapture.
Rowen: A stubble field left unplowed till late in the autumn, that it may be cropped by cattle.
Raillery: Pleasantry or slight satire; banter; jesting language; satirical merriment.
&Verbar;Robe-de-chambre: A dressing gown, or morning gown.
Resorcylic: Of, or pertaining to, or producing, resorcin; as, resorcylic acid.
Reillumination: The act or process of enlightening again.
Riparious: Growing along the banks of rivers; riparian.
Rollerskate: to glide on roller skates, as one might on ice skates.
Reappointment: The act of reappointing, or the state of being reappointed.
Rockling: Any species of small marine fishes of the genera Onos and Rhinonemus (formerly Motella), allied to the cod. They have three or four barbels.
Roughstrings: Pieces of undressed timber put under the steps of a wooden stair for their support.
Reed: A name given to many tall and coarse grasses or grasslike plants, and their slender, often jointed, stems, such as the various kinds of bamboo, and especially the common reed of Europe and North America (Phragmites communis).
Reef: To reduce the extent of (as a sail) by rolling or folding a certain portion of it and making it fast to the yard or spar.
Refashion: To fashion anew; to form or mold into shape a second time.
Reek: To emit vapor, usually that which is warm and moist; to be full of fumes; to steam; to smoke; to exhale.
Reel: The act or motion of reeling or staggering; as, a drunken reel.
Reem: To open (the seams of a vessel's planking) for the purpose of calking them.
Re\u00ebnaction: The act of reënacting; the state of being reënacted.
Rhymer: One who makes rhymes; a versifier; -- generally in contempt; a poor poet; a poetaster.
Raffinose: A colorless crystalline slightly sweet substance obtained from the molasses of the sugar beet.
Revere: To regard with reverence, or profound respect and affection, mingled with awe or fear; to venerate; to reverence; to honor in estimation.
Rivered: Supplied with rivers; as, a well rivered country.
&Verbar;Rajpoot: A Hindoo of the second, or royal and military, caste; a Kshatriya; especially, an inhabitant of the country of Rajpootana, in northern central India.
Renerve: To nerve again; to give new vigor to; to reinvigorate.
Rabdology: The method or art of performing arithmetical operations by means of Napier's bones. See Napier's bones.
Reduvid: Any hemipterous insect of the genus Redivius, or family Reduvidæ. They live by sucking the blood of other insects, and some species also attack man.
Rascaldom: State of being a rascal; rascality; domain of rascals; rascals, collectively.
Rappel: The beat of the drum to call soldiers to arms.
Retry: To try (esp. judicially) a second time; as, to retry a case; to retry an accused person.
Rheinberry: One of the berries or drupes of the European buckthorn; also, the buckthorn itself.
Ranchman: An owner or occupant of, or laborer on, a ranch; a herdsman.
Religious: A person bound by monastic vows, or sequestered from secular concern, and devoted to a life of piety and religion; a monk or friar; a nun.
&Verbar;Rumen: The first stomach of ruminants; the paunch; the fardingbag. See Illust. below.
Remittal: A remitting; a giving up; surrender; as, the remittal of the first fruits.
Rigadoon: A gay, lively dance for one couple, -- said to have been borrowed from Provence in France.
Riding: The act or state of one who rides.
Rock: To move or be moved backward and forward; to be violently agitated; to reel; to totter.
Rove: The act of wandering; a ramble.
resile: To start back; to recoil; to recede from a purpose.
Ringtoss: A game in which the object is to toss a ring so that it will catch upon an upright stick.
Ripler: One who brings fish from the seacoast to markets in inland towns.
Reamputation: The second of two amputations performed upon the same member.
Riddance: The act of ridding or freeing; deliverance; a cleaning up or out.
&Verbar;Retinula: One of the group of pigmented cells which surround the retinophoræ of invertebrates. See Illust. under Ommatidium.
Rotella: Any one of numerous species of small, polished, brightcolored gastropods of the genus Rotella, native of tropical seas.
Rigidulous: Somewhat rigid or stiff; as, a rigidulous bristle.
Run-around: A whitlow running around the finger nail, but not affecting the bone.
Roominess: The quality or state of being roomy; spaciousness; as, the roominess of a hall.
Refractoriness: The quality or condition of being refractory.
Ripper act: An act or a bill conferring upon a chief executive, as a governor or mayor, large powers of appointment and removal of heads of departments or other subordinate officials.
Reflection: The act of reflecting, or turning or sending back, or the state of being reflected.
Robalo: Any of several pikelike marine fishes of the West Indies and tropical America constituting the family Oxylabracidæ, esp. the largest species (Oxylabrax undecimalis, syn. Centropomus undecimalis), a valuable food fish called also snook, the smaller species being called Rob`a*li"to (&unr_;).
Rurally: In a rural manner; as in the country.
Revolution: The act of revolving, or turning round on an axis or a center; the motion of a body round a fixed point or line; rotation; as, the revolution of a wheel, of a top, of the earth on its axis, etc.
Rhymery: The art or habit of making rhymes; rhyming; -- in contempt.
Rod: A straight and slender stick; a wand; hence, any slender bar, as of wood or metal (applied to various purposes).
Redstreak: A kind of apple having the skin streaked with red and yellow, -- a favorite English cider apple.
Rouse: To get or start up; to rise.
Regardless: Having no regard; heedless; careless; as, regardless of life, consequences, dignity.
Relay cylinder: In a variable expansion central-valve engine, a small auxiliary engine for automatically adjusting the steam distribution to the load on the main engine.
Radioconductor: A substance or device that has its conductivity altered in some way by electric waves, as a coherer.
Ridable: Suitable for riding; as, a ridable horse; a ridable road.
Resultless: Being without result; as, resultless investigations.
Rodomontade: To boast; to brag; to bluster; to rant.
&Verbar;Radula: The chitinous ribbon bearing the teeth of mollusks; -- called also lingual ribbon, and tongue. See Odontophore.
Religionize: To bring under the influence of religion.
Redintegrate: To make whole again; a renew; to restore to integrity or soundness.
Reflower: To flower, or cause to flower, again.
Rouge dragon: One of the four pursuivants of the English college of arms.
Rheumic: Pertaining to, or characterized by, rheum.
Regent: One who rules or reigns; a governor; a ruler.
Readable: Such as can be read; legible; fit or suitable to be read; worth reading; interesting.
Remark: Act of remarking or attentively noticing; notice or observation.
Romaunt: A romantic story in verse; as, the “Romaunt of the Rose.”
&Verbar;Ridotto: A favorite Italian public entertainment, consisting of music and dancing, -- held generally on fast eves.
Replace: To place again; to restore to a former place, position, condition, or the like.
Rifling: The act or process of making the grooves in a rifled cannon or gun barrel.
Ruby-tailed: Having the tail, or lower part of the body, bright red.
Ripienist: A player in the ripieno portion of an orchestra. See Ripieno.
Rosin: To rub with rosin, as musicians rub the bow of a violin.
Ramshackle: To search or ransack; to rummage.
Replaceability: The quality, state, or degree of being replaceable.
&Verbar;Rhabdoc\u0153la: A suborder of Turbellaria including those that have a simple cylindrical, or saclike, stomach, without an intestine.
Rental: A schedule, account, or list of rents, with the names of the tenants, etc.; a rent roll.
Requirement: The act of requiring; demand; requisition.
Rheoscope: An instrument for detecting the presence or movement of currents, as of electricity.
Recrement: Superfluous matter separated from that which is useful; dross; scoria; as, the recrement of ore.
Refract: To bend sharply and abruptly back; to break off.
&Verbar;Rhinotheca: The sheath of the upper mandible of a bird.
Rasper: One who, or that which, rasps; a scraper.
Rope: To bind, fasten, or tie with a rope or cord; as, to rope a bale of goods.
Roman: A native, or permanent resident, of Rome; a citizen of Rome, or one upon whom certain rights and privileges of a Roman citizen were conferred.
&Verbar;Rectus: A straight muscle; as, the recti of the eye.
Resettlement: Act of settling again, or state of being settled again; as, the resettlement of lees.
Rabbitry: A place where rabbits are kept; especially, a collection of hutches for tame rabbits.
Retardation: The act of retarding; hindrance; the act of delaying; as, the retardation of the motion of a ship; -- opposed to acceleration.
Recto-vesical: Of or pertaining to both the rectum and the bladder.
Retreatful: Furnishing or serving as a retreat.
Reptile: An animal that crawls, or moves on its belly, as snakes,, or by means of small, short legs, as lizards, and the like.
Rotche: A very small arctic sea bird (Mergulus alle, or Alle alle) common on both coasts of the Atlantic in winter; -- called also little auk, dovekie, rotch, rotchie, and sea dove.
Reserved: Kept for future or special use, or for an exigency; as, reserved troops; a reserved seat in a theater.
Reinsure: To insure again after a former insuranse has ceased; to renew insurance on.
Receivedness: The state or quality of being received, accepted, or current; as, the receivedness of an opinion.
Rhetorician: Suitable to a master of rhetoric.
Repassage: The act of repassing; passage back.
Rhinestone: A colorless stone of high luster, made of paste. It is much used as an inexpensive ornament.
&Verbar;Riksdaler: A Swedish coin worth about twenty-seven cents. It was formerly the unit of value in Sweden.
Racemed: Arranged in a raceme, or in racemes.
Reducing agent: a substance that causes reduction of another substance in a chemical reaction, as by donating electrons or adding hydrogen atoms; as, lithium hydride is a powerful reducing agent.
Rigorous: Manifesting, exercising, or favoring rigor; allowing no abatement or mitigation; scrupulously accurate; exact; strict; severe; relentless; as, a rigorous officer of justice; a rigorous execution of law; a rigorous definition or demonstration.
Retortion: Act of retorting or throwing back; reflection or turning back.
Rescussor: One who makes an unlawful rescue; a rescuer.
Russian roulette: An act of bravado played by loading one bullet into one chamber of a revolver in which the cylinder has five or six positions, spinning the cylinder (thus moving the bullet randomly to one of the six positions of the cylinder), pointing the gun to one's head, and pulling the trigger.  If the bullet is in firing position, the "player" is usually killed. Such a "game" may be played on a dare, or, in some places, as part of a gamble.
Rapidity: The quality or state of being rapid; swiftness; celerity; velocity; as, the rapidity of a current; rapidity of speech; rapidity of growth or improvement.
Resist: A substance used to prevent a color or mordant from fixing on those parts to which it has been applied, either by acting machanically in preventing the color, etc., from reaching the cloth, or chemically in changing the color so as to render it incapable of fixing itself in the fibers; -- also called reserve. The pastes prepared for this purpose are called resist pastes.
Reconciliation: The act of reconciling, or the state of being reconciled; reconcilenment; restoration to harmony; renewal of friendship.
Resisting: Making resistance; opposing; as, a resisting medium.
Restiform: Formed like a rope; -- applied especially to several ropelike bundles or masses of fibers on the dorsal side of the medulla oblongata.
Rectilineal: Straight; consisting of a straight line or lines; bounded by straight lines; as, a rectineal angle; a rectilinear figure or course.
Rolly-poly: A kind of pudding made of paste spread with fruit, rolled into a cylindrical form, and boiled or steamed.
razor-thin: as thin as a razor blade; very thin.
Re\u00ebnforced concrete: Concrete having within its mass a system of iron or steel supports, such as bars, rods, or a heavy mesh, to provide increased tensile strength and shear resistance.  Same as Ferro-concrete.
Roller blade: a type of roller skate having more than two wheels, aligned in a single row rather than in two rows.
Repugnance: The state or condition of being repugnant; opposition; contrariety; especially, a strong instinctive antagonism; aversion; reluctance; unwillingness, as of mind, passions, principles, qualities, and the like.
Rhotacism: An oversounding, or a misuse, of the letter r; specifically (Phylol.), the tendency, exhibited in the Indo-European languages, to change s to r, as wese to were.
Recentness: Quality or state of being recent.
Roach-backed: Having a back like that of roach; -- said of a horse whose back a convex instead of a concave curve.
Recently: Newly; lately; freshly; not long since; as, advices recently received.
Ringleader: The leader of a circle of dancers; hence, the leader of a number of persons acting together; the leader of a herd of animals.
&Verbar;Rinforzando: Increasing; strengthening; -- a direction indicating a sudden increase of force (abbreviated rf., rfz.) Cf. Forzando, and Sforzando.
relativity: The state of being relative; as, the relativity of a subject.
Rambutan: A Malayan fruit produced by the tree Nephelium lappaceum, and closely related to the litchi nut. It is bright red, oval in shape, covered with coarse hairs (whence the name), and contains a pleasant acid pulp. Called also ramboostan.
Romish: Belonging or relating to Rome, or to the Roman Catholic Church; -- frequently used in a disparaging sense; as, the Romish church; the Romish religion, ritual, or ceremonies.
Re\u00eblection: Election a second time, or anew; as, the reëlection of a former chief.
Rationality: The quality or state of being rational; agreement with reason; possession of reason; due exercise of reason; reasonableness.
Refuter: One who, or that which, refutes.
Red-hand: Having hands red with blood; in the very act, as if with red or bloody hands; -- said of a person taken in the act of homicide; hence, fresh from the commission of crime; as, he was taken red-hand or red-handed.
Roughing-in: The first coat of plaster laid on brick; also, the process of applying it.
&Verbar;Radiata: An extensive artificial group of invertebrates, having all the parts arranged radially around the vertical axis of the body, and the various organs repeated symmetrically in each ray or spheromere.
Roughwork: To work over coarsely, without regard to nicety, smoothness, or finish.
Releasor: One by whom a release is given.
Receptive: Having the quality of receiving; able or inclined to take in, absorb, hold, or contain; receiving or containing; as, a receptive mind.
Register: To enroll one's name in a register.
Rochet: The red gurnard, or gurnet. See Gurnard.
Ramie: The grasscloth plant (Bœhmeria nivea); also, its fiber, which is very fine and exceedingly strong; -- called also China grass, and rhea. See Grass-cloth plant, under Grass.
Reflexible: Capable of being reflected, or thrown back.
Recompense: An equivalent returned for anything done, suffered, or given; compensation; requital; suitable return.
Rumpus: A disturbance; noise and confusion; a quarrel.
Reminiscential: Of or pertaining to reminiscence, or remembrance.
Repeating: Doing the same thing over again; accomplishing a given result many times in succession; as, a repeating firearm; a repeating watch.
Ready-made: Made already, or beforehand, in anticipation of need; not made to order; as, ready-made clothing; ready-made jokes.
Robin: A small European singing bird (Erythacus rubecula), having a reddish breast; -- called also robin redbreast, robinet, and ruddock.
Re-present: To present again; as, to re-present the points of an argument.
Remiped: An animal having limbs like oars, especially one of certain crustaceans.
Restringency: Quality or state of being restringent; astringency.
Revie: To exceed an adversary's wager in card playing.
Recusant: One who is obstinate in refusal; one standing out stubbornly against general practice or opinion.
Restrict: To restrain within bounds; to limit; to confine; as, to restrict worlds to a particular meaning; to restrict a patient to a certain diet.
Rooftree: The beam in the angle of a roof; hence, the roof itself.
&Verbar;Rhamnus: A genus of shrubs and small trees; buckthorn. The California Rhamnus Purshianus and the European Rhamnus catharticus are used in medicine. The latter is used for hedges.
Rest cure: Treatment of severe nervous disorder, as neurasthenia, by rest and isolation with systematic feeding and the use of massage and electricity.
Refill: To fill, or become full, again.
Rancidity: The quality or state of being rancid; a rancid scent or flavor, as of old oil.
Recaption: The act of retaking, as of one who has escaped after arrest; reprisal; the retaking of one's own goods, chattels, wife, or children, without force or violence, from one who has taken them and who wrongfully detains them.
Rhatany: The powerfully astringent root of a half-shrubby Peruvian plant (Krameria triandra). It is used in medicine and to color port wine.
Ratiocination: The process of reasoning, or deducing conclusions from premises; deductive reasoning.
Ricinine: A bitter white crystalline alkaloid (C8H8N2O2) extracted from the seeds of the castor-oil plant (Ricinus communalis).  Called also ricidine.  Ingestion may cause vomiting and various other toxic reactions, including liver and kidney damage, convulsions, hypotension, and death.
&Verbar;Rhabdophora: An extinct division of Hydrozoa which includes the graptolities.
Roughrider: One who breaks horses; especially (Mil.), a noncommissioned officer in the British cavalry, whose duty is to assist the riding master.
Respection: The act of respecting; respect; regard.
Regard: A look; aspect directed to another; view; gaze.
Radiately: In a radiate manner; with radiation or divergence from a center.
Rim: To furnish with a rim; to border.
Recoil: A starting or falling back; a rebound; a shrinking; as, the recoil of nature, or of the blood.
Ringbill: The ring-necked scaup duck; -- called also ring-billed blackhead. See Scaup.
Reyse: To go on a military expedition.
Rupee: A silver coin, and money of account, in the East Indies.
Rudderhead: The upper end of the rudderpost, to which the tiller is attached.
Riddler: One who speaks in, or propounds, riddles.
Request: To ask for (something); to express desire ffor; to solicit; as, to request his presence, or a favor.
Reliable: Suitable or fit to be relied on; worthy of dependance or reliance; trustworthy.
Regalian: Pertaining to regalia; pertaining to the royal insignia or prerogatives.
Radiophony: The art or practice of using the radiophone.
Rennin: A milk-clotting enzyme obtained from the true stomach (abomasum) of a suckling calf.  Mol. wt. about 31,000.  Also called chymosin, rennase, and abomasal enzyme.
Radiophone: An apparatus for the production of sound by the action of luminous or thermal rays. It is essentially the same as the photophone.
Reassertion: A second or renewed assertion of the same thing.
Rudistes: An extinct order or suborder of bivalve mollusks characteristic of the Cretaceous period; -- called also Rudista. See Illust. under Hippurite.
Reave: To take away by violence or by stealth; to snatch away; to rob; to despoil; to bereave. [Archaic].
Recrimination: The act of recriminating; an accusation brought by the accused against the accuser; a counter accusation.
Resinous: Of or pertaining to resin; of the nature of resin; resembling or obtained from resin.
Reversionary: That which is to be received in reversion.
Repleader: A second pleading, or course of pleadings; also, the right of pleading again.
Requisitive: One who, or that which, makes requisition; a requisitionist.
Refulgence: The quality of being refulgent; brilliancy; splender; radiance.
ricinoleic acid: An organic acid (C18H34O3) obtained from the castor-oil plant (Ricinus communis, or Palma Christi) and other species of the family Euphorbiaceae; chemicaly it is d-12-hydroxyoleic acid (CH3(CH2)5.CH(OH).CH2.CH=CH.(CH2)7COOH).   Formerly called palmic acid.
Rememorate: To recall something by means of memory; to remember.
Running load: The air pressure supported by each longitudinal foot segment of a wing.
Remigration: Migration back to the place from which one came.
Rhachidian: Of or pertaining to the rhachis; as, the rhachidian teeth of a mollusk.
Ruddiness: The quality or state of being ruddy; as, the ruddiness of the cheeks or the sky.
Regorge: To vomit up; to eject from the stomach; to throw back.
Roccellic: Pertaining to, or designating, a dibasic acid of the oxalic series found in archil (Roccella tinctoria, etc.), and other lichens, and extracted as a white crystalline substance C17H32O4.
Review: A second or repeated view; a reëxamination; a retrospective survey; a looking over again; as, a review of one's studies; a review of life.
Ropedancer: One who dances, walks, or performs acrobatic feats, on a rope extended through the air at some height.
Repent: To feel pain on account of; to remember with sorrow.
Rubber: One who, or that which, rubs.
Rep-silver: Money anciently paid by servile tenants to their lord, in lieu of the customary service of reaping his corn or grain.
Reattachment: The act of reattaching; a second attachment.
Roughdry: in laundry work, to dry without smoothing or ironing.
Resolvent: That which has the power of resolving, or causing solution; a solvent.
Resuscitation: The act of resuscitating, or state of being resuscitated.
Resolutely: In a resolute manner; with fixed purpose; boldly; firmly; steadily; with perseverance.
Remurmur: To murmur again; to utter back, or reply, in murmurs.
Redstart: A small, handsome European singing bird (Phoenicurus phoenicurus, formerly Ruticilla phoenicurus), allied to the nightingale; -- called also redtail, brantail, fireflirt, firetail.  The black redstart is Phoenicurus ochruros (formerly Phoenicurus tithys), and is now rare and protected by law in England.  The name is also applied to several other species of Ruticilla and allied genera, native of India.
Roseworm: The larva of any one of several species of lepidopterous insects which feed upon the leaves, buds, or blossoms of the rose, especially Cacæcia rosaceana, which rolls up the leaves for a nest, and devours both the leaves and buds.
Ryder: A clause added to a document; a rider. See Rider.
Roccellin: A red dyestuff, used as a substitute for cochineal, archil, etc.  It consists of the sodium salt of a complex azo derivative of naphtol.
Reformer: One who effects a reformation or amendment; one who labors for, or urges, reform; as, a reformer of manners, or of abuses.
Red-riband: The European red band fish, or fireflame. See Rend fish.
Regiminal: Of or relating to regimen; as, regiminal rules.
